text: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the Twitter acquisition deal at a lower price is "not out of the question", shares of Twitter fell by 8% to close at $37.39. The stocks fell below the $39.31 closing price on April 1, when Musk had revealed his Twitter stake. The Twitter deal is currently on hold over fake accounts data.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC becomes 5th largest firm by m-cap after shares list at 9% discount
text: LIC has become the fifth-largest firm in the country by market capitalisation after it was listed at a 9% discount today. After listing, its market capitalisation rose to ₹5.70 lakh crore on BSE. In market capitalisation, ahead of LIC were Reliance Industries (₹16.74 lakh crore), TCS (₹12.38 lakh crore), HDFC Bank (₹7.23 lakh crore), Infosys (₹6.30 lakh crore) on BSE.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter deal at a lower price is not out of the question, says Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the Twitter acquisition deal being viable at a lower cost is "not out of the question". Speaking at a conference, Musk said, "You can't pay the same price for something that is much worse than they claimed." He also said, "The more questions I ask, the more my concerns grow."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex logs best day in over 2 months, jumps 1,345 points to end at 54,318
text: The BSE Sensex and Nifty logged their best day in more than two months on Tuesday, aided by gains in metal, energy and oil and gas stocks. While the Sensex rallied 1,345 points to end at 54,318, the Nifty jumped 417 points to end at 16,259. It's also the second-best day for Sensex and Nifty over the last fifteen months.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investors lose ₹42,500 crore within minutes of LIC listing at 9% discount
text: Investors lost over ₹42,500 crore in minutes on Tuesday after LIC's market capitalisation slipped to ₹5.57 lakh crore in early trade against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹867 on the BSE, which is an 8.64% discount from its IPO price of ₹949. On NSE, it debuted at a discount of 8.11%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: McDonald's looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia
text: McDonald's is looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia after it announced its exit from the country after 30 years of operation. However, it won't allow stores to use its name, logo, branding and menu. It also said it would ensure its 62,000 employees in Russia continue to be paid until the closure of any transaction.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tomato prices rise up to ₹100 per kg in Bengaluru: Report
text: The retail price of tomatoes has risen to between ₹80 and ₹100 per kilogram in Bengaluru and adjoining areas, according to a report. This comes as the heavy rainfall and Cyclone Asani in Karnataka have greatly affected the tomato crop, resulting in skyrocketing prices, the report added. The prices of several other green vegetables have also reportedly witnessed a rise.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders: Chairman
text: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders, said Chairman MR Kumar after the insurer's IPO made its stock market debut on Tuesday. "We will ensure that whatever bonuses [policyholders] have been getting is maintained or even increased. In a couple of years, even though the percentage goes down, the quantum of bonus goes up," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bharti Airtel's net profit rises over 2 fold YoY to ₹2,008 cr in Q4
text: Bharti Airtel on Tuesday reported a 165% YoY rise in its net profit in Q4 FY22 to ₹2,008 crore, against ₹759 crore in Q4 FY21. Its consolidated revenues in Q4 rose 22% YoY to ₹31,500 crore, up from ₹25,747 crore. Bharti Airtel's consolidated profit after tax for FY22 jumped to ₹4,255 crore from the loss of ₹15,083 crore in FY21.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: McDonald's to exit Russia after 32 years, sell its business in the country
text: McDonald's on Monday said it's selling its Russian business, marking the American fast-food chain's exit from Russia after 32 years in the country. McDonald's cited humanitarian crisis caused by the Russia-Ukraine war, adding that its Russian business "is no longer tenable, nor is it consistent with McDonald's values". McDonald's has 850 restaurants in Russia that employ 62,000 people.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sri Lanka left with only one day of petrol stock, warns new PM
text: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe in an address to the nation on Monday said, "At the moment, we only have petrol stocks for a single day." He said the crisis-hit country urgently needed $75 million in foreign exchange to pay for essential imports. "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani offers to buy 26% of Ambuja, ACC for $6.5 bn after $10.5 bn Holcim deal
text: Gautam Adani has made an open offer to acquire a 26% stake each in Ambuja Cements and ACC from public shareholders for $6.5 billion. A day ago, Adani announced a $10.5 billion deal to acquire Holcim's India business. Notably, Holcim holds 63.19% in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC (of which 50.05% is held through Ambuja Cements).
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: They want to muddy the topic: Jeff Bezos on US govt criticising his recent tweets
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "They understandably want to muddy the topic," on the White House's statement about his tweets opposing taxing the rich corporations to tame inflation. It accused Bezos of opposing an "economic agenda for the middle class that cuts some of the biggest costs families face". Earlier, Bezos accused US President Joe Biden of "misdirection" over inflation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
text: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bitcoin has no future as a payments network: FTX's billionaire CEO
text: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's 30-year-old billionaire CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, has said that Bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reported. The billionaire also criticised the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs. Later in a tweet, he clarified, "To be clear, I also said that it does have potential as a store of value."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter CEO posts long thread on spam accounts, Musk replies with poop emoji
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Monday tweeted a long thread on spam accounts amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s proposed acquisition being put on hold over fake accounts data. Speaking about Musk’s plan to identify bots, Parag said “We don't believe that this specific estimation can be performed externally”. In reply to this, Musk tweeted a poop emoji.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm to not acquire Raheja QBE; to apply for new general insurance license
text: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has said that its proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance Company Limited has been called off. It cited the reason, "As the share sale and purchase transaction hasn't...consummated within the time period envisaged by the parties under the...agreement." The company said it intended to apply for a new general insurance license.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Renault sells Russia business for 1 ruble to govt-backed entity: Reports
text: French automaker Renault reached a deal to sell its Russia business and its majority 68% stake in Russia's biggest automaker AvtoVAZ for one ruble, reports said on Monday. Renault's stake in AvtoVAZ would be sold to the state-backed Russian Central Research and Development Automobile and Engine Institute. Renault sold its AvtoVAZ stake with a six-year option to buy it back.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Global wheat prices hit record high after India bans export
text: After India banned wheat exports earlier this week, wheat prices touched a new record high of €435 ($453) per tonne as the Euronext market opened on Monday. The prices had reached the previous record high of €422 on Friday, as supplies from Russia and Ukraine (both major wheat exporters) have been disrupted. Wheat futures traded in Chicago also rose 5.9%.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: You spend more time drinking coffee & eating cheese: UK PM on work from home
text: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson in an interview said that working from home doesn’t work. Johnson said, "My experience of working from home is you spend an awful lot of time making another cup of coffee and then...walking very slowly to the fridge, hacking off a small piece of cheese...and then forgetting what...you were doing."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Group liable for fines on Ambuja Cements & ACC; no tax liability for Holcim
text: The Holcim Group has said that there will be no indemnity or tax liability for them in its $10.5 billion transaction where it sold its stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC to the Adani Group. The Adani group is now liable for anti-trust fines against Ambuja Cements and ACC in India which are being litigated in the Supreme Court.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: World's most valuable company Saudi Aramco's profits surge by over 80% in Q1
text: Saudi Aramco has said that its profits jumped by more than 80% in the first three months of the year. The first-quarter earnings of the firm showed a record net income of $39.5 billion, up from $21.7 billion during the same period last year. Notably, Saudi Aramco overtook Apple as the world’s most valuable company last week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC shares trade at a discount in grey market ahead of listing: Reports
text: The shares of LIC were trading at a discount of ₹19 in the grey market on Monday, according to multiple reports. The ₹20,557 crore IPO of the state-run insurer, with the price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, was oversubscribed nearly three times its issue size. The LIC shares will be listed on the stock exchanges on May 17.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's second-largest economy China's retail sales fall to lowest in over 2 years
text: Retail sales of the world's second-largest economy, China, slumped to its lowest in over two years while factory output plunged, official data showed. It's the biggest slump since March 2020 as Chinese consumers remained mostly at home amid coronavirus restrictions. This also comes amid China and its business hub Shanghai adhering to strict coronavirus measures, negatively affecting supply chains.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Banks to approach RBI to change definition of 'fraud': Report
text: Several banks will approach the Reserve Bank of India asking to change the definition of the word "fraud", according to a report. At present, all banks need to label a borrowing company as 'fraud account' if it has been marked by one lender. As per bankers, this often leads to legalities even after the amount is repaid by the borrower.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Group to buy 49% stake in Quintillion Business Media
text: Adani's AMG Media Networks will buy a 49% stake in Raghav Bahl-run platform Quintillion Business Media Ltd (QBML) for an undisclosed amount. It signed a Shareholders' Agreement with Quintillion Media Ltd (QML), QBML and a share purchase agreement with QML, QBML and Quint Digital Media Ltd (QDML). In March, Adani Group said it will acquire a minority stake in QBML.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Goldman Sachs allows senior employees to take unlimited leaves
text: Goldman Sachs will allow partners and managing directors to take as much time off as they want under a new "flexible vacation" to "rest and recharge", according to an internal memo. "As of May 1, there will be no cap on paid leave and senior staff can take time off without a fixed vacation day entitlement," the memo said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US FDA warns Sun Pharma over quality lapses at Gujarat plant: Report
text: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has flagged production-related quality control and procedural lapses at India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma's facility in Gujarat's Halol, it has been reported. The health authority reportedly also observed deficient equipment and laboratory standards. It conducted a good manufacturing inspection there from April 26 to May 9.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Non-profit behind collapsed Terra ecosystem to compensate users
text: The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG), a non-profit organisation that supports the Terra ecosystem, on Monday announced that it will compensate the remaining users of TerraUSD/UST, after the stablecoin collapsed last week. "We're still debating through various distribution methods," the LFG tweeted. It spent millions of dollars worth of crypto trying to defend UST's dollar peg last week, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India overtakes Germany as 4th largest vehicle market: Report
text: India surpassed Germany to become the world's fourth largest automotive market in 2021, data by the Organisation Internationale des Constructeurs d'Automobiles (OICA) showed. As per the data, India saw 3,759,398 vehicles sold in 2021, compared to 2,973,319 vehicles in Germany. The most number of vehicles were sold in China, followed by the US and Japan.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Sri Lanka plans to privatise national airline to help pay off debt
text: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday proposed privatising national airline Sri Lankan Airlines as part of reforms aimed at paying off the economic crisis-hit country's debts. "It shouldn't be that this loss has to be borne by the poorest of the poor," Wickremesinghe said. He added that the airline made a loss of SLR 45 billion in FY21.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI may hike interest rates to pre-pandemic levels by Aug: SBI Research
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will inevitably hike interest rates in the upcoming monetary policy meetings and may take the rates up to pre-pandemic levels of 5.15% by August, according to a report by SBI Research. The report added that the rate hikes will be a result of biting inflation caused by the Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No merit: Aditya Birla Capital on report claiming corruption caused CEO's exit
text: Aditya Birla Capital (ABC) on Monday said outgoing CEO Ajay Srinivasan is transitioning to a new role being crafted at the group level. This comes after a news report, citing a whistleblower letter, alleged that Srinivasan was asked to leave due to corruption, insider trading and front running. "These insinuations/allegations are bereft of facts," said the ABC spokesperson.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt puts Pawan Hans sale on hold over concerns about winning bidder
text: The Centre has decided to put on hold the sale of its 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility. The decision was taken after concerns were raised over Almas Global Opportunity Fund, one of the majority stakeholders of Star9 Mobility. NCLT had sanctioned Almas Global over its failure to pay after successfully bidding to acquire Kolkata-based EMC Limited.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI bans Urja Global, 4 people from securities market for 2 years
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has banned energy provider and operator, Urja Global, and four individuals from dealing in the securities market for two years. It found that Urja Global made a false and misleading scheme for a corporate announcement in connection with Nippon Shinyaku. Various other disclosure lapses were also observed.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 2 Mumbai homebuyers to get 7 times the price of undelivered flats
text: About 27 years after they booked flats in City Builders' City Embassy project in Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai, Gul Achra and Kanta Achra will receive ₹91 lakh and ₹88 lakh respectively as the builder failed to complete the project. While Gul had booked a flat worth ₹12.56 lakh in November 1995, Kanta had booked another flat for ₹13.16 lakh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: What are stablecoins, the product that led to a massive selloff in crypto market?
text: Stablecoin is a utility token built upon another coin's blockchain to create a cryptocurrency that's non-volatile, by maintaining its value at $1. However, stablecoin TerraUSD/'UST' collapsed from $1 to as low as 13 cents this week. Terra's token LUNA, meant to stabilise UST prices, fell 100% to a fraction of a cent, causing a massive selloff in crypto market.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Will fulfil all commitments: Minister Puri on G7's criticism over India's wheat export ban
text: After the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations criticised India's decision to halt wheat exports, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted, "Wheat stocks are comfortable." He said, "India, a reliable supplier will fulfil all commitments including needs of neighbours and vulnerable countries." He added, "Decision to restrict wheat exports taken with focus on India's food security."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India bans wheat exports with immediate effect
text: The Indian government has banned the export of wheat with immediate effect. The Centre said that there has been a sudden spike in prices of wheat due to which "the food security of India, neighbouring countries and other vulnerable countries is at risk". Shipments of wheat are allowed for letters of credit that have already been issued, the government said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Global stocks record 6th consecutive losing week, longest since 2008
text: The global stocks dipped for the sixth consecutive week while the FTSE All-World index is on its longest weekly losing streak since the middle of 2008. The index dropped 2.2% this week, while the US benchmark S&P 500 index fell 2.4% and Nasdaq dipped by 2.8%. The Dow slipped for the seventh consecutive week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani to buy Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC for $10.5 billion
text: Adani Group on Sunday announced that it will acquire Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC. The value for Holcim's stake and open offer consideration is about $10.5 billion. It will be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group and the largest-ever transaction in India's infrastructure and materials space. Switzerland-based Holcim holds 63.19% stake in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: $11 trillion wiped out in worst losing streak for global stocks since 2008 crisis
text: As much as $11 trillion has been wiped out from the markets amid the worst losing streak for global stocks since the 2008 financial crisis, Bloomberg reported. The valuations of companies across the US and Europe have lowered due to the selloff in MSCI ACWI Index, MSCI's global equity index. Morgan Stanley and Citigroup strategists expect stocks to fall further.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Unable to sell Sputnik Light stock over Ukraine war, B'luru manufacturer writes to PM
text: Director of Bengaluru-based manufacturer of COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik Light, wrote to PM Narendra Modi requesting procurement of their doses as they are unable to sell 2.5 crore units due to the Russia-Ukraine war. Notably, DCGI has granted emergency use permission to Sputnik Light. Arun Kumar requested that the government should acquire the available doses failing which they will get wasted.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: As with Warne in March, Symonds' innings ended way too soon: Adani
text: Businessman Gautam Adani condoled former Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' death in a car accident aged 46. "As with Warne in March, Symonds' innings ended way too soon," Adani tweeted, referring to former Australia cricketer Shane Warne's death aged 52 in March 2022. "Shocked by the loss of Symonds who epitomized presence both on and off the field," Adani added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter legal called to complain I violated NDA by revealing bot check sample size: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter's legal team accused him of violating a non-disclosure agreement by revealing that the sample size for the social media platform's checks on automated users is 100. Musk tweeted, "Twitter legal just called to complain that I violated their NDA by revealing the bot check sample size is 100! This actually happened."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Netflix not the best place for you if you can't support our content: Netflix to staff
text: Netflix has sent a memo telling its employees that they might have to work on shows that they "perceive to be harmful", as it refuses to "censor specific artists or voices". It added, "We program for a diversity of audiences and tastes...If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth, Netflix may not be the best place for you."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Started Dell with just $1,000 in 1984, made $101 bn in revenue in 2021: CEO
text: Michael Dell, CEO of Dell Technologies, took to LinkedIn to share a memory of how he started the company. He wrote, "A fun memory from 34 years ago. I started Dell Technologies in 1984 with $1,000 in my...university...dorm room." He added that by 1987, Dell had posted $159 million in revenue and in 2021 its revenue grew to $101 billion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: G7 nations criticise India's decision to stop exporting wheat: Germany
text: The Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, UK, US) condemn India's decision to halt wheat exports, Germany said. German Agriculture Minister Cem Ozdemir said, "If everyone starts to impose export restrictions or close markets, that would worsen the crisis." The government has said that export has been banned to protect India's food security.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Govt extends wheat procurement season till May 31, 2022
text: The government on Sunday announced that the wheat procurement season has been extended till May 31, 2022. "Present geopolitical situation and market prices may also affect the projected procurement of wheat during the current Rabi marketing season 2022-23 under the central pool," a government order said. Union Minister Piyush Goyal said it will "ensure that no wheat farmer faces inconvenience".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adanis not interested in politics: Adani Group on reports of Rajya Sabha nomination
text: Adani Group has issued a clarification denying reports that India's richest man Gautam Adani or his wife, Dr Priti Adani, might be nominated to Rajya Sabha. "These are blatantly false reports...Neither Mr Gautam Adani or Dr Priti Adani nor any member of the Adani family has interest in a political career or in joining any political group," the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt lists 3 reasons for ban on wheat exports
text: After government banned wheat export, Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam listed 3 reasons. "Reason for ban is to protect...food security of our citizens, ensure adequate food supply to...public distribution system and ensure that we're able to direct food supplies to vulnerable food-deficit countries," he said. "There's no dramatic fall in production, also no need to imagine shortage," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India added 8.8 million jobs in April 2022: CMIE report
text: Indian labour markets saw substantially increased activity during April 2022 as the labour force increased by 8.8 million from 428.4 million in March to 437.2 million in April, according to a Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) report. "This is one of the largest monthly increases in the labour force if we exclude the lockdown impacted months," the report added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Biden says 'wealthiest firms must pay fair share to lower inflation', Bezos responds
text: The world's second richest person and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos responded after US President Joe Biden said that inflation could be brought down by making sure that the "wealthiest corporations pay their fair share". Bezos tweeted, "Raising corp taxes is fine to discuss. Taming inflation is critical to discuss. Mushing them together is just misdirection."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SBI hikes lending rate by 10 bps; 2nd such hike in 2 months
text: State Bank of India has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across tenures with effect from May 15. Notably, this is SBI's second hike in MCLR in two months. An increase in MCLR will lead to a rise in EMIs for those who have availed home, vehicle and personal loans.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet fuel prices hiked by 5% to climb new record high in Delhi
text: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) have been hiked by 5% to reach a record-high of ₹1,23,039.71 per kilolitre (₹123.03 per litre) in Delhi, as per a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. Jet fuel makes up 40% of the running cost of an airline and ATF prices have been hiked every fortnight since the beginning of 2022.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: UAE-based telecom group acquires 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion
text: Emirates Telecommunications Group Company PJSC (e&) has acquired a 9.8% stake in Vodafone Group for $4.4 billion. With this, the UAE-based company has become the largest shareholder in Vodafone, Bloomberg reported. e& said that it has "made the investment in Vodafone to gain significant exposure to a world leader in connectivity and digital services".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Copy-paste error by SBI clerk leads to transfer of ₹1.5 cr to wrong accounts in T'gana
text: A copy-paste error by an SBI clerk led to the transfer of ₹1.50 crore meant for the Telangana government's Dalit Bandhu scheme being mistakenly deposited into the accounts of 15 employees of Lotus Hospitals. Of those 15 who received ₹10 lakh each, 14 of them returned the money while one person used some of the money to clear previous debts.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Reliance to buy dozens of brands for its consumer goods business: Report
text: Reliance Industries is planning to acquire dozens of small grocery and non-food brands as it targets building its own $6.5 billion consumer goods business, Reuters reported. The company is reportedly planning to build a portfolio of 50-60 grocery, household and personal care brands. As per Reuters, it is in final stages of negotiations with around 30 popular local consumer brands.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: There are mountains to climb: Air India's new CEO to ex-colleagues in farewell note
text: Campbell Wilson, who has been appointed as Air India's CEO and MD, sent a farewell note to Scoot employees. After praising Scoot, Wilson wrote, "There are other mountains to climb, and I am humbled to have been selected…It's a fantastic opportunity to lead a historic airline, now owned by the Tata Group...I am grateful to embark on that...challenge."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani to become India's 2nd biggest cement maker with $10.5 bn Holcim deal
text: Adani Group on Sunday acquired Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC in a $10.5 billion deal, making it the second-biggest cement producer in India. Ambuja and ACC have a combined capacity to produce at least 70 million tonnes of cement annually, second to UltraTech Cement's  120 million tonnes capacity. This will also be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Asia's richest man Adani nears $10 bn deal for Holcim's India business: Report
text: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani is nearing a deal to buy Swiss building material company Holcim's India business, Bloomberg reported. Adani Group will pay $10 billion for 63.1% of Ambuja Cements Ltd, currently held by Holcim, along with its related assets. The deal is expected to make Adani Group a sizeable player in the cement sector, the report added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: London-based CEO offers to pay employees in gold to beat inflation
text: London-based Cameron Parry, the CEO of financial services company TallyMoney, has offered his employees the possibility to get paid in gold rather than pounds in order to beat inflation. "With the cost of living crisis going from bad to worse, it didn't make sense to continue offering pay hikes in pounds when its value is being eroded further," Parry said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Relied on Twitter's earlier filings: Musk on fake account data
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked by a Twitter user why he didn't think of fake accounts percentage earlier, said, "I relied upon the accuracy of Twitter's public filings." This comes after Musk announced that his Twitter deal was temporarily put on hold. Musk's team will do a random sampling of 100 Twitter followers to check for fake accounts.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Twitter deal is temporarily on hold, tweets Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Friday tweeted that his $44 billion deal to take Twitter private is "temporarily on hold". The deal has been put on hold "pending details supporting calculation that spam/fake accounts do indeed represent less than 5% of users", Musk said. Shares of the micro-blogging site fell over 20% in pre-market trading after Musk's tweet.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Expect more change for better: Twitter CEO after firing 2 top executives
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Saturday shared a detailed thread about the changes in the company after two top executives were fired a day before. Parag wrote, "So what can you expect from me going forward? I'm still focused on doing the job, and that includes making hard decisions as needed...And you can expect more change for the better."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Won't use Musk's deal to avoid making important decisions: Twitter CEO
text: After two top executives were fired on Friday, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said he won't use the acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk "as an excuse to avoid making important decisions" for Twitter. He wrote, "While I expect the deal to close, we need to be prepared for all scenarios…Our industry is in a very challenging macro environment...right now."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No one at Twitter working just to keep lights on: CEO on changes in company
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a post remarked that "no one at Twitter is working just to keep the lights on." The post which came after two top executives were fired, further read, "Some have been asking why a "lame-duck" CEO would make these changes if we're getting acquired anyway…Regardless of the company's future ownership, we're...improving Twitter as a product."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Investors lose nearly ₹19 lakh crore in five trading sessions
text: The wealth of equity investors tumbled by over ₹18.74 lakh crore as the market indices continued to fall for the fifth session on Thursday. While the Sensex plunged 1,158 points to end at 52,930 on Thursday, the Nifty plunged 359 points to settle at 15,808. Markets continued to remain under pressure in sync with the global markets slump, experts said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter fires 2 top executives, freezes hiring ahead of Musk's takeover
text: Twitter on Thursday confirmed it has fired two of its senior executives who oversaw consumer and revenue divisions and has paused hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's takeover of the company. CEO Parag Agrawal in a memo to his employees also said Twitter will review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Employee fired by Twitter changes bio to 'unemployed'; thanks team members
text: The second top executive who was fired by Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, has changed his Twitter bio to ‘unemployed’. In a now deleted tweet, Bruce Falck, who oversaw revenue, had written, “I'll clarify that I too was fired by (Parag)." Falck later thanked his team in a tweet thread and said he can't wait to see their future work.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla shares gain after Elon Musk puts $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
text: Shares of Tesla surged 4% on Friday after its CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk said he has temporarily put the $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter on hold. Tesla shares have lost about 25% of their value since Musk disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Meanwhile, Twitter stock plunged 10% after Musk's announcement on Friday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: WazirX, CoinDCX delist crypto token LUNA after it crashes nearly 100%
text: Indian crypto exchanges WazirX and CoinDCX are delisting crypto token LUNA after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. LUNA crashed after its sister token, TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, lost its peg. CoinDCX said that it has also delisted UST from its app with immediate effect.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Still committed to acquisition: Musk after putting $44 billion Twitter deal on hold
text: Elon Musk tweeted he's "still committed to acquisition" after he put on hold the $44 billion deal to take Twitter private. Musk has temporarily put the deal on hold while he awaits data supporting Twitter's claim that spam accounts comprise less than 5% of users. Twitter shares fell to their lowest level since Musk disclosed his stake after the announcement.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla puts on hold plans to sell electric cars in India over import duties: Report
text: Tesla has reportedly put on hold plans to sell electric cars in India after the company failed to secure lower import taxes. Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has abandoned a search for showroom space in the country and reassigned some of its domestic team, Reuters reported citing sources. In 2021, Musk had said that India has the world's highest import duties.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Blockchain behind collapsed UST, LUNA tokens resumes activity after 9-hour halt
text: The blockchain behind stablecoin TerraUSD, or UST, and its affiliated LUNA token has resumed activity after a nine-hour halt on Friday. The Terra blockchain had stopped processing new transactions for the second time in less than a day after UST and LUNA collapsed. Several crypto exchanges, including WazirX, CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber, delisted LUNA from their platforms on Friday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CoinSwitch delists LUNA as it crashes 100%, CEO says 'meltdown is rapid'
text: CoinSwitch Kuber CEO Ashish Singhal on Friday tweeted that the crypto exchange is delisting Terra's LUNA crypto token after it crashed nearly 100% in the last 24 hours. "The last few days have been tough for all of us...The meltdown of the Terra ecosystem and LUNA have been rapid and devastating," Singhal said, noting that it is "a tough decision".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla shares dropped by 26% ever since Musk offered to buy Twitter
text: Shares of Tesla have slipped by 26% ever since its CEO and world’s richest person Elon Musk offered to takeover Twitter on April 14. The shares have plunged on the fears that Musk will get distracted with Twitter. Meanwhile, shares of Twitter slipped to $45.23 on Thursday, nearly 20% below Musk’s offer price of $54.20 per share.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SoftBank to cut fundings by half this yr after $26 bn Vision Fund loss
text: SoftBank may cut its startup investments this fiscal year by half or even a quarter of what it did in 2021, CEO Masayoshi Son said on an earnings call. The move follows a record loss reported by SoftBank's Vision Fund that stood at $26 billion for FY22. The firm had posted a record quarterly profit a year ago.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Las Vegas casino gives ₹3.86 lakh bonus to each of its 5,400 employees
text: A Las Vegas casino has announced a $5,000 (around ₹3.86 lakh) bonus for all its 5,400 employees. "It's you, every single day, that makes a difference....Whether you clean the rooms, cook the food, dealing cards, serving drinks, at the front desk." said Daniel Espino, Cosmopolitan chief people officer. The all-employee bonus will cost us more than $27 million, company said.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales resigns amid tax evasion probe
text: Xiaomi India's director of offline sales, Sunil Baby, has resigned. The company said he decided to move on for personal reasons. Notably, there has been a report of tax officials freezing deposits worth $478 million lying in local bank accounts of Xiaomi in February as part of a probe into alleged tax evasion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt raises ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC priced at ₹949
text: The government has raised ₹20,560 crore as India's biggest-ever IPO of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) has been priced at the top of the range at ₹949. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake, was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding. LIC is likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Not planning company-wide layoffs: Twitter CEO to staff after 2 executives fired
text: After Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal fired two top executives and froze hiring ahead of Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s takeover, he shared a memo with this staff. He wrote that while no "company-wide layoffs" are planned, "leaders will continue making changes" to improve efficiencies as needed. He added, "It’s​​ critical to have the right leaders at the right time."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: LIC sets IPO issue price at ₹949; listing likely on Tuesday: Report
text: LIC has set its IPO issue price at ₹949 a share, at the top of its indicated range of ₹902-949, as per a report. It is likely to be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The country's largest-ever IPO opened on May 4 and was oversubscribed 2.95 times on its final day of bidding on May 9.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Not how I imagined leaving Twitter: Executive who was sacked during paternity leave
text: The Twitter executive who led the company's consumer division and was fired by CEO Parag Agrawal, revealed that he is currently on his paternity leave. Kayvon Beykpour tweeted, "This isn't how and when I imagined leaving Twitter...this wasn't my decision. Parag asked me to leave after letting me know that he wants to take the team in a different direction."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Global crypto regulation body likely in next year: IOSCO Chair
text: The International Organisation of Securities Commissions' (IOSCO) Chair Ashley Alder said global market regulators are likely to launch a joint body within the next year to better co-ordinate cryptocurrency rules. "There's a wall of worry about this (crypto)...at an institutional level," Alder stated. He added that the main concerns are cyber security and a lack of transparency, among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Sanctions on Russia won't affect global oil supply: IEA
text: The International Energy Agency (IEA) said the world won't be left short of oil even with lower output from sanctions-hit Russia. "Steadily rising volumes from...OPEC+ and the US along with a slowdown in demand growth is expected to fend off an acute supply deficit," the IEA said. This comes after it predicted a possible global oil "supply shock" in March.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Inflation impacted rich more than poor in FY22: Finance Ministry
text: Evidence on consumption patterns suggests that inflation in India has impacted the low-income strata lesser than the high-income groups, Finance Ministry wrote in its economic review report for April. It stated that in FY22, inflation for the bottom 20% of urban consumers fell to 5.7% from 6.8%. Meanwhile, inflation for the top 20% fell to 5.7% from 6.5%, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India in relatively stronger position than many nations: Finance Secy
text: India is economically in a relatively stronger position than many other countries, Finance Secretary TV Somanathan said. He stated that owing to the large domestic production of wheat, India has at least escaped the global foodgrain crisis amid Ukraine-Russia war. However, he added that India cannot be immune to geopolitical challenges as it's part of the global economy.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Ashni Biyani resigns as Future Consumer MD due to 'personal constraints'
text: Ashni Biyani, daughter of Future Group CEO Kishore Biyani, has resigned as the MD of Future Consumer Limited citing "personal constraints and challenges", the company said in a stock exchange filing on Thursday. "She has also ceased to be a 'key managerial personnel' of the company," the company further said. She will continue to serve as Future Consumer's Non-Executive Director.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's industrial output rises from 1.5% in Feb to 1.9% in Mar
text: India's industrial output, measured in terms of the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 1.9% in March, up from 1.5% in February. This comes after data released on April 29 showed output of India's eight core sectors grew 4.3% YoY in March 2022, down from 6% in February 2022. The eight sectors account for 40.3% of IIP.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's retail inflation surges to 7.79% in April, highest in 8 years
text: India's retail inflation surged to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014, data released by the government on Thursday showed. At 7.79%, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation for April is higher than the March number of 6.95%. Earlier this month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das had said inflation was "expected to be elevated" in April.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.55 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.55 against the US dollar. The rupee slumped 30 paise in opening trade as a lacklustre trend in the domestic equity markets and a firm American currency weighed on investor sentiment, reports said. Besides, persistent foreign fund outflows and elevated crude oil prices impacted the domestic unit, forex traders said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: List of 10 highest-paid sportspersons released by Forbes
text: Argentina and PSG forward Lionel Messi was the highest-paid sportsperson over the past year with earnings of $130 million, as per Forbes' list of 10 highest-paid sportspersons. It is the second time that Messi has topped the list. He is followed by LeBron James ($121.2 million) and Cristiano Ronaldo ($115 million)
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Over $200 billion wiped off cryptocurrency market in 24 hours
text: More than $200 billion of wealth was wiped out from the cryptocurrency market in just 24 hours amid a massive sell-off, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing CoinMarketCap data. The crypto plunge was driven by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin. The plunge affected major tokens and Bitcoin plunged by as much as 10% to its lowest level since December 2020.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Saudi Aramco dethrones Apple as world's most valuable company
text: World's biggest crude exporter Saudi Aramco has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. The Saudi state-run oil company's market cap rose to $2.43 trillion on Wednesday after its shares surged due to higher oil prices. Meanwhile, Apple's market capitalisation fell to $2.37 trillion after its share price tanked 5.2% on Wednesday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Stablecoin UST, that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, crashes to 40 cents
text: TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, plunged over 55% on Wednesday from 24 hours earlier to around 40 cents. Its sister token fell more than 80% to $5 and other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether also plunged. A stablecoin is a digital currency pegged to a "stable" reserve asset like the US dollar.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,158 points to close at 52,930 in the 5th-straight session of fall
text: Sensex fell for the fifth-straight day on Thursday, crashing 1,158 points to close at 52,930, while Nifty closed 359 points lower at 15,808. The market indices dropped over 2%, dragged by banking, financial and metal stocks amid worries over April inflation data and a decline in global stocks. Adani Ports, IndusInd Bank and Tata Steel were among the top losers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investors lose over ₹13 lakh crore in a four-day decline in stocks
text: A four-day decline in stocks has wiped out over ₹13.32 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms. The BSE Sensex plummeted 276 points to close at 54,088 in its fourth-straight session of decline on Wednesday. Larsen & Toubro, Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, PowerGrid, NTPC, Infosys and Maruti were among the top losers in the Sensex pack on Wednesday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SRK-led Knight Riders Group acquires Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League
text: Shah Rukh Khan-led Knight Riders Group has acquired the Abu Dhabi franchise in UAE's T20 League.  "We're excited about becoming part of UAE’s T20 League, which no doubt will become hugely successful," Shah Rukh said. As many as six teams will compete in UAE's T20 League. Reliance Industries Limited also owns a team in the league.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Health, digital adoption among '5 megatrends' for the future: Tata Sons Chairman
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has listed 'Digital adoption', 'Supply chain rebalance', 'Sustainability', 'Health' and 'Global talent pool' as the "five megatrends" for the future. He said these will have a "big impact" on economies, countries and businesses globally.  "All businesses will have to become AI and data businesses...No industry can escape this trend," he said on digital adoption.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Siemens announces exit from Russian market, condemns Ukrainian war
text: German multinational conglomerate Siemens will quit the Russian market due to the war in Ukraine. "We join the international community in condemning the war in Ukraine and are focused on supporting our people and providing humanitarian aid," CEO Roland Busch said. Siemens reportedly employs around 3,000 people in Russia and had earlier decided not to take on new projects there.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Child sandwiched between parents on scooter motivated me to build Nano: Tata
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Tata Nano, the compact car that he launched in 2008. "What really motivated me...was constantly seeing Indian families on scooters, maybe the child sandwiched between the mother and father," Tata wrote on building Nano. "Nano was always meant for all our people," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Misleading: Air India on woman's panic attack video after boarding denied at airport
text: Air India said, "It's conveying a misleading image of Air India being apathetic towards a passenger," after a video showed that a woman allegedly suffered a panic attack at Delhi airport. In the video shared on Instagram, it was alleged the woman and her relatives were denied boarding by Air India staff due to a delay of a few minutes.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Campbell Wilson appointed CEO and MD of Air India
text: Tata Sons has appointed Campbell Wilson as the new CEO and MD of Air India. "It's an honour to be selected to lead the iconic Air India. It's at the cusp of an exciting journey to become one of the best airlines," Wilson said. The 50-year-old New Zealand-born executive recently resigned as CEO of Singapore Airlines budget carrier Scoot.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: HC allows Xiaomi conditional access to seized ₹5,551 cr: Report
text: The Karnataka High Court has declined to reinstate a freeze on ₹5,551 crore belonging to Chinese smartphone-maker Xiaomi, Hindustan Times reported citing Reuters. The funds were seized by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with "illegal outward remittances" but the seizure was stayed after Xiaomi appealed. The Court also allowed Xiaomi to use a bank overdraft facility to make payments.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk's delay in disclosing Twitter stake under probe by US SEC: WSJ
text: The US SEC is investigating Tesla CEO Elon Musk's delay in disclosing his Twitter stake last month, the WSJ reported. Musk had revealed his 9.2% stake in Twitter to SEC on April 4, a delay of at least 10 days since surpassing the 5% threshold for revealing a shareholding. Musk has lately been embroiled in a dispute with the SEC.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 24x7 digital payments helpline 'DigiSaathi' now on WhatsApp: NPCI
text: The government's 24x7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' that provides information on digital payment products and services is now available on WhatsApp, the National Payments Commission of India (NPCI) said. Users can access the helpline by texting +91-892-891-3333 via WhatsApp. It answers queries on cards, UPI, NEFT, RTGS, Wallets, ATM, QR (UPI/Bharat), mobile and net banking, among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SoftBank's Vision Fund reports record $26 billion loss
text: Japan's SoftBank Group reported a record $26.2 billion loss at its Vision Fund investment arm on Thursday. The group also reported a net loss of $13.2 billion for the financial year that ended March 31. This is reportedly its biggest full-year loss which followed a nearly $38.8 billion net profit in the previous fiscal year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Toyota to make EV parts in India for domestic, export markets
text: Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Senior VP Vikram Gulati said the firm plans to make EV parts in India to meet domestic demand as well as for export to Japan and some ASEAN countries. It plans to start with making e-drives or electric powertrain parts used by different EV types. Gulati added Toyota aspires to make India manufacturing hub for cleaner technologies.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Ford drops plans to make EVs for exports in India
text: Ford Motor has dropped plans to make electric vehicles (EVs) in India for exports. "After careful review, we have decided to no longer pursue EV manufacturing for exports from any of the Indian plants," a spokesperson said. In September 2021, Ford had announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over 10 years.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Govt eases environmental rules for coal mines to tackle fuel crisis
text: The Centre has eased environmental approvals for expansion of coal mines to boost output amid the ongoing fuel crisis across the country. A government note said the move will enable raising coal production by a further 10% without requiring new impact assessments. Rules on consulting local residents about the expansions have also been loosened, the note added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: State laws don't apply to RBI-registered NBFCs: Supreme Court
text: State moneylending laws would have no application on non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) registered with and regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Supreme Court (SC) said on Tuesday. The court observed that the Chapter III­B of the RBI Act is a complete code in itself. Earlier,  the Kerala High Court had said the state moneylending laws were applicable.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Ramkrishna, Subramanian's bail pleas in NSE scam case rejected
text: A Delhi court on Thursday dismissed the bail pleas filed by NSE's ex-CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. The CBI told the court that the accused, holding influential positions, could tamper with the evidence and must be kept in custody. Ramkrishna has been accused of frequently revising Subramanian's designation.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SC refuses interim relief to those seeking stay on LIC IPO allotment
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to grant interim relief to petitioners who challenged amendments to the LIC Act by Finance Act of 2021 and demanded a stay on the insurer's IPO allotment process. "We're not inclined to grant any interim relief," SC said. It also sought the Centre and LIC's replies on the batch of pleas within eight weeks.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Step up exports to $100 bn for $1 tn economy by 2030: Tamil Nadu CM
text: Tamil Nadu's export share stands at $26 billion and this should be increased to $100 billion by 2030, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said. He added that this would help meet the Centre's target of achieving $1 trillion economy by 2030. The southern zone's share in India's exports will increase from 27% to 35% in five years, he further said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: US inflation rises 8.3% in April, slight drop from March's 40-yr-high
text: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.3% in April from 12 months earlier, the country's Labor Department said on Wednesday. This is however below the 8.5% y-o-y rise in March, which was the highest rate in 40 years since 1981. On a month-to-month basis, prices rose 0.3% from March to April, the smallest increase in eight months.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecasts by 30 bps
text: Morgan Stanley has lowered its forecasts for India's GDP growth to 7.6% for FY23 and 6.7% for FY24, 30 basis points lower than the previous estimates. Both inflation and the country's current account deficit will likely get worse, it said. The report cited a global slowdown, surging oil prices and weak domestic demand as some of the reasons.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Bill Gates tests positive for COVID-19
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter on Tuesday and wrote, "I've tested positive for COVID-19. I'm experiencing mild symptoms and am following the experts' advice by isolating until I'm healthy again." "I'm fortunate to be vaccinated and boosted and have access to testing and great medical care," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bitcoin briefly drops below $30,000 for first time since July 2021
text: Bitcoin, in the early hours of Tuesday, fell below $30,000 for the first time since July 2021. Its value fell as low as $29,764 on Tuesday before recovering above $30,000. Bitcoin's value has more than halved from its all-time high which was close to $69,000 in November. The fall in cryptocurrencies followed a drop in US equities and other markets.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SBI hikes interest rates on bulk term deposits from today
text: SBI has increased interest rates on its bulk term deposits of ₹2 crore and above across all its tenors except for the 7-45 days tenor. Effective from May 10, for the 46-179 days tenor, the rate has been increased to 3.50% from 3% and for 180-210 days tenor, the rate has been hiked to 3.50% from 3.10%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Layout of 'world's first Bitcoin City' in El Salvador unveiled, President shares pics
text: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has shared the layout of the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that will initially be funded by Bitcoin-backed bonds. Bukele shared on Twitter pictures of a gold-coloured 3D model and rendered images of the city. 'Bitcoin City' will be constructed at the foot of a volcano which is being used to mine Bitcoin using geothermal energy.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
text: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Office as we know it, is over: Airbnb CEO on letting staff work remotely forever
text: After Airbnb allowed its employees to work remotely forever, the company's CEO Brian Chesky said, "I think that the office as we know it, is over." He added, "We can't try to hold on to 2019 any more than 1950. We have to move forward." Chesky questioned whether the office would be invented today if it didn't already exist.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
text: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: After Musk's Taj Mahal tweet, his mother says his grandparents flew there in 1954
text: After Elon Musk tweeted he visited Taj Mahal in 2007 and called it a "wonder of the world", his mother Maye Musk shared that his grandparents flew to the Taj Mahal from South Africa in 1954. She tweeted, "The only people to ever do this trip in a single-engine propeller plane, without a radio or GPS. Their motto 'Live dangerously...carefully'."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: When are you coming to deliver 1st Tesla? Paytm CEO on Musk's Taj Mahal tweet
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to react to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet on the Taj Mahal. Sharma tweeted, "It'll be an incredible challenge for Tesla to build FSD for India. We're known to be the most unruly road users. That said, when are you coming here to deliver the first Tesla here at the Taj?
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zomato's market cap falls below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion
text: Zomato's market capitalisation fell below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion on Tuesday after the food delivery platform's shares hit a new all-time low. Zomato's shares fell 7.22% on Tuesday to end at ₹52.65 on the NSE, giving it a market capitalisation of about $5.3 billion. Notably, Zomato's rival Swiggy was valued at $10.7 billion earlier this year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: JSW Group will make a $7 billion bid for Ambuja Cements, ACC: Chairman
text: JSW Group's Chairman Sajjan Jindal told Financial Times that the steel-to-energy conglomerate will make a $7 billion bid for Holcim's India subsidiaries Ambuja Cements and ACC. JSW will offer $4.5 billion in its own equity and $2.5 billion from undisclosed private equity partners for the bid. It was earlier reported that Adani Group is in talks to acquire Holcim's assets.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low against US dollar
text: The Pakistani rupee fell to an all-time low against US dollar on Tuesday in the interbank market. Its value surged by 82 paisa in early trade and is currently trading at PKR 188.35 in the interbank market. Meanwhile, State Bank of Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell by $328 million to $10.558 billion during the week that ended on April 23.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pfizer to buy Biohaven for $11.6 bn in its biggest deal since 2016
text: Pfizer will acquire biotech group Biohaven Pharmaceuticals for $11.6 billion, marking its biggest deal since 2016. Biohaven's Rimegepant medication, used as both a treatment and preventative for migraines, is expected to bring in sales of over $4 billion by 2030. This comes as Pfizer expects sales of its COVID-19 vaccines to drop from last year's highs.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
text: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
text: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tiger Global hit by $17 bn losses in tech stock sell-off: Report
text: Tiger Global has faced losses of around $17 billion during this year's technology stock sell-off, the Financial Times reported. The firm has erased around two-thirds of its gains in four months, the report added citing calculations by LCH Investments. The losses are reportedly higher than some of the $4-trillion hedge fund industry's most recent losses.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla halts production at China plant due to supply issues: Report
text: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai plant due to issues with securing parts for its EVs, Reuters reported citing sources. Tesla's Shanghai plant produces the Model 3 sedan and Model Y crossover for the China market and for export. Tesla partially resumed production at the plant on April 19 following a 22-day closure caused by the city's COVID-19 lockdown.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India looking at tapping new markets for edible oil: Sitharaman
text: India is looking at tapping new markets for the import of edible oils, following the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "There are various hurdles in terms of importing oils. You know we are not able to import edible oil; we were getting sunflower oil. Now, we are not," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Axis Bank awaits probe report on alleged mutual fund scam: Report
text: Axis Bank will wait for the report on an investigation into alleged front-running at Axis Mutual Fund (MF) before taking the final decision on penalising guilty officials, Moneycontrol reported. The allegations are being probed by two external agencies appointed by Axis MF. The probe was launched in February 2022, Axis MF MD and CEO Chandresh Nigam said on May 8.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's outward FDI drops nearly 50% y-o-y to $3.39 bn in April
text: India's outward foreign direct investment (OFDI) nearly halved to $3.39 billion in April on an annual basis, data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. In comparison, the OFDI stood at $6.71 billion in April 2021 and $3.44 billion in March 2022. The equity component in April was $544.87 million and loans amounted to $764.25 million.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Canara Bank detects frauds worth ₹3.9 cr in internal probe: Report
text: State-led Canara Bank is investigating fraud in its housing finance unit Can Fin Homes after a whistleblower alleged irregularities in certain accounts, Reuters reported quoting a source. The bank has detected frauds in 37 accounts worth ₹3.9 crore, the source said. They added that fake income tax return documents had been submitted for these accounts.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: CBI raids 8 places in Jammu, Srinagar, Mumbai in J&K Bank scam case
text: The CBI on Tuesday searched eight locations in Jammu, Srinagar and Mumbai in connection with alleged irregularities in purchase of a building by J&K Bank in Mumbai in 2010, officials said. They added that this included searching the premises of then J&K Bank Chairman Haseeb Drabu. In April, the ED questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in the same case.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Equity investors' wealth falls over ₹11.22 lakh crore in 3 days
text: Equity investors have become poorer by over ₹11.22 lakh crore in three days following a sell-off in markets amid weak global cues. Sensex fell for the third consecutive session on Tuesday, falling 1,337.38 points or 2.4% since Friday. Foreign institutional investors remained net-sellers on Monday, offloading shares worth a net ₹3,361.80 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We need to revitalise world economy in inclusive ways: Raghuram Rajan
text: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that in order to raise investment and productivity, the need is to revitalise global growth in inclusive ways. In an article published in Financial Times, Rajan said, "The easiest solution economically, and the hardest politically, is to reverse the trend to deglobalisation." Developing countries' public spending has been constrained in the pandemic, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Malaysia may cut palm oil export tax by half: Report
text: The Commodities Ministry of the world's second-largest palm oil producer Malaysia has proposed to cut the export tax on the oil by half amid a global edible oil shortage. Malaysia's Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Zuraida Kamaruddin told Reuters that the country could temporarily cut the tax from 8% to 4%-6%. Recently, top global producer Indonesia banned palm oil exports.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.42 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Reuters reported. Asian markets were lower on Monday as US stock futures fell on fears of more policy tightening from the Federal Reserve and strict lockdown in Shanghai impacting global growth, according to Reuters.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bitcoin falls to the lowest level since January, trades below $34,000
text: Bitcoin fell on Monday to as low as $33,266 in morning trade, nearing January's low of $32,951 as slumping equity markets continued to hurt cryptocurrencies. It then steadied to trade above $33,600. According to BBC, the world's largest cryptocurrency has fallen by 50% since its peak in November 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Made best possible decision: IndiGo on barring differently-abled child from flight
text: IndiGo's CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline made "the best possible decision" by barring a differently-abled teenager and his family from boarding a Ranchi-Hyderabad flight. "At boarding area, the teenager was visibly in panic...the airport staff, in line with safety guidelines, were forced to make a difficult decision," Dutta said. IndiGo offered to purchase an electric wheelchair for the child.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rupee closes at all-time low of 77.50 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee weakened further on Monday to close at a new all-time low of 77.50 against the US dollar, 60 paise over its previous close. During the trading session, the rupee touched its lifetime low of 77.52. The currency was weighed down by elevated crude oil prices and a widening trade deficit.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's biggest IPO of LIC subscribed nearly 3 times on final day of bidding
text: LIC's IPO, India's biggest IPO which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, was subscribed 2.95 times on Monday. Expected to raise ₹20,557 crore, the IPO received bids for 47.83 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholders' portion was subscribed 6.11 times, employees bid 4.39 times and retail investors bid 1.99 times.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I will do my best to stay alive: Musk to his mother after 'mysterious dying' tweet
text: Soon after Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a tweet about his "mysterious death", his mother Maye Musk commented that it wasn't funny. Responding to her, Musk wrote, "Sorry! I will do my best to stay alive." Musk's 'dying' tweet came after he shared a statement by the Roscosmos director that threatened him for supplying "fascist forces" to Ukraine.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: If I die under mysterious circumstances, nice knowing ya: Musk after Russian threats
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Shortly before this, Musk shared a post that he said was a statement by the Roscosmos director Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin to Russian media that accused Musk of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," the statement read.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' to cut costs: CEO
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi told employees in an e-mail that the company needs to cut costs, citing "the market is experiencing a seismic shift", CNBC reported. "We'll treat hiring as a privilege and be deliberate about when and where we add headcount," the CEO said. "We have to make sure our unit economics work before we go big," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investigating it myself: Scindia after IndiGo denies boarding to differently-abled child
text: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said he is investigating the matter himself wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport. He added that appropriate action will also be taken. A social media post along with a video of the incident went viral on Sunday after it detailed how IndiGo staff denied boarding to the child.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: FM Sitharaman gets water for NSDL MD during her speech at an event, video viral
text: A video has surfaced on social media wherein Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman could be seen offering water to the Managing Director of National Securities Depository Limited, Padmaja Chunduru. While Chunduru asked for water from hotel staff during her speech, Sitharaman came on stage and offered her water during the event held to celebrate the silver jubilee of NSDL.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt calls meeting with Uber, Ola amid rising consumer complaints
text: The Centre has called a meeting with cab aggregators Ola and Uber on Tuesday to discuss their policies after it received various complaints from consumers about their unfair trade practices, ride cancellation policy and surge pricing, among others. It will also seek information from them on how they calculate fares, cancellation charges and measures for consumer data protection.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: GST Council may consider highest 28% tax on cryptocurrencies: Report
text: The GST Council is considering levying a 28% tax on cryptocurrencies and their related services, as per a report. While the proposal is likely to be discussed in the next GST Council meeting, its date is yet to be decided. Notably, the Finance Ministry has already imposed a 30% income tax on earnings from virtual digital asset transactions.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: British airline EasyJet to take out seats from planes so it can fly with fewer crew
text: British low-cost airline EasyJet plans to remove seats on some of its planes so it can operate flights with fewer cabin crew. The airline, which has been facing a staff shortage, is cancelling around 30 flights daily. It will be removing the back row from 60 of its A319 jets, which will limit the passengers to 150 instead of 156.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US imposes new sanctions on 27 Gazprombank, 8 Sberbank executives
text: The US on Sunday imposed new sanctions against three Russian television stations and banned 27 executives from Gazprombank in response to Ukraine's invasion of Russia. This is the first time that the US has imposed sanctions involving Russian gas exporter Gazprombank. The new sanctions also included eight executives from Sberbank, and Moscow Industrial Bank and its 10 subsidiaries.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rupee is in ICU under PM Modi: Cong after rupee hits all-time low
text: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Monday said the Indian rupee "is in ICU (intensive care unit)" under PM Narendra Modi's government after the rupee fell to an all-time low of ₹77.42 against the US dollar. Surjewala said rising inflation and depleting foreign reserves are causing the rupee to fall. "BJP-sponsored" communal tension is also responsible for the fall, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Paytm grants 39.7 lakh ESOPs to employees as its share price falls
text: Paytm-parent One97 Communications has granted 39.7 lakh new employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs) to its employees as Paytm's share price fell to one of its lowest levels since November. The exercise price of the new ESOPs has been set at ₹9 each. As per Paytm's stock price on Monday, the value of the ESOPs is estimated to be ₹220.7 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Toyota to invest ₹4,800 cr in Karnataka, will create 3,500 jobs
text: The Toyota Group has signed an MoU with the Karnataka government for a ₹4,800 crore investment in the state. As per the company's statement, the investment aims to promote green technology and set up local manufacturing facilities to build electric powertrain parts and components. The move will generate around 3,500 direct jobs, said Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Executive VP Vikram Gulati.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Retail investors have become shock absorbers in equities: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said retail investors have played a key role in the markets in the last two years. "[They] have shown...what they can do by standing up and becoming shock absorbers, unlike FPIs," she stated. Her statement comes as foreign portfolio investors pulled out ₹6,417 crore from the Indian stock markets in the first week of May.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC IPO shares to be allocated on May 12, listing on May 17
text: Bidders in LIC IPO will be allocated shares on May 12, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has said. He added that LIC will be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, received 47.83 crore bids against 16.2 crore shares on offer.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Reliance's shares decline 3% after Q4 results, fall 9.8% in 6 days
text: Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) shares declined 3% to ₹2,542.10 in the early hours of trading on Monday after the company's January-March quarter results were declared. RIL's shares have fallen 9.82% since April 29. RIL reported a 22.5% YoY rise in net profit to ₹16,203 crore and a 35% YoY rise in consolidated revenue to ₹2.32 lakh crore in Q4 FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Airports raises $250 million for airports development
text: Adani Airports has raised $250 million funding from a consortium of Standard Chartered and Barclays Bank with an option to raise another $200 million. The funds raised will be used to scale up the airports business into "one of the largest airport platforms globally," a spokesperson said. Adani Airports manages airports in Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Mangaluru and Jaipur, among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC's public issue has been successful: DIPAM Secretary
text: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Monday said the LIC's IPO offer "has met with tremendous success". The LIC IPO, which started on May 4, has been closed today after being oversubscribed 2.95 times. While the policyholder position has been subscribed 6.11 times, the employees portion has been subscribed 4.39 times.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Deeply distressed with rumour mongering: Axis AMC Founder CEO on alleged scam
text: Axis Asset Management Company (AMC) Founder CEO Rajiv Anand on Monday said he is deeply depressed with rumour mongering regarding allegations that two of fund managers (FMs) at Axis Mutual Fund have been removed from their positions for front-running. "If there is a problem, we will address it. Do not malign the reputations of the highly skilled professionals," Anand said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Unemployment rate fell from 10.3% to 8.7% in Oct-Dec 2021: NSO
text: The unemployment rate for people above 15 years in urban areas slipped from 10.3% to 8.7% between October and December 2021, the National Statistical Office (NSO) data revealed on Sunday. Among males, the unemployment rate dipped to 8.3% in October-December 2021 compared to 9.5% a year ago. Meanwhile, among females, the rate fell from 13.1% to 10.5% y-o-y.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres
text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres in a case filed by multi-business chemicals firm SRF. As per SRF, Birla Tyres defaulted on payment of ₹15.84 crore for the supply of tyre cord fabric as of July 8, 2021. NCLT reprimanded Birla Tyres for taking a "casual attempt" to seek adjournments.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC IPO booked 1.79 times on Day 5; policyholders booked 5.04 times
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) public issue was subscribed 1.79 times on the fifth day of bidding on Sunday. The offer has received bids for 29.07 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore equity shares. The policyholder portion was booked 5.04 times, followed by the employee portion, which was booked 3.79 times.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Twitter CEO's wife is General Partner at VC firm backing Musk's Twitter deal
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal's wife Vineeta Agarwala is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, the venture capital (VC) firm that has agreed to invest $400 million in Elon Musk's Twitter takeover deal. Vineeta leads investments for Andreessen Horowitz's biotech and medical fund. As per reports, Musk is expected to serve as the temporary Twitter CEO after he completes the takeover.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk, Twitter sued by Florida pension fund to delay $44 bn deal
