text: Elon Musk and Twitter were sued by a Florida pension fund seeking to stop Musk from completing his $44 billion buyout before 2025. The fund cited a Delaware law under which shareholders who own over 15% of a company can't enter a merger without two-thirds of remaining shares granting approval. Musk is effective "owner" of over 15% of Twitter shares.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk didn't have plan for Twitter: CEO of Binance which is investing $500 mn in buyout
text: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Financial Times that the cryptocurrency exchange's $500 million investment to help Elon Musk acquire Twitter is "more of a blank cheque". He said, "[Musk] didn't have a plan for Twitter. There isn't...a business plan." Zhao further said, "After the investment...Elon will figure out what he wants to do, and we'll be supportive of that."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who is Jared Birchall, who manages the world's richest man Elon Musk's wealth?
text: Jared Birchall is the Managing Director of Excession, the family office of the world's richest man Elon Musk that handles his almost $250 billion fortune. Birchall also serves various roles at the Musk Foundation, Musk's school Ad Astra and his brain-implant startup Neuralink, and several of Musk's other LLCs. He has recently helped Musk secure financing for $44-billion Twitter takeover.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Work ethic expectations from Twitter employees will be extreme: Elon Musk
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "work ethic expectations would be extreme" after he completes the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. He added that expectations from Twitter employees will be "much less than I demand of myself". Musk earlier said Twitter will be "super focussed" on software engineering, design, information security and server hardware after he acquires Twitter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon driver leaves 'kind' message for girl fighting cancer in US, Bezos reacts
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Instagram Stories to share the story of Amazon driver Asani Anderson who left a message for an 8-year-old girl battling cancer in US while dropping off packages. "Amazon is praying 4 Aubrey luv you!" the message by Anderson read. Reacting to the gesture, Bezos wrote on Instagram, "Kindness makes our world better...Anderson embodies it."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Baseless and untrue: ED as Xiaomi alleges it threatened staff with 'violence'
text: After Xiaomi alleged in a court filing that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during a probe by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the agency responded saying that the claims are "untrue and baseless". The ED said that "there was no coercion or threat to the officers of the company" and that they deposed their statements before ED voluntarily.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Best investment you'll make: Poonawalla suggests Musk to make Tesla cars in India
text: The Serum Institute of India's Adar Poonawalla on Sunday suggested Tesla CEO Elon Musk to invest in India by manufacturing Tesla cars in the country. Poonawalla wrote, "Just in case you don't end up buying Twitter, do look at investing...in India for high-quality large-scale manufacturing of Tesla cars. I assure you this will be the best investment you'll ever make."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bled through my pants, couldn't get a tampon during meeting: TikTok ex-employee
text: A former employee at TikTok claimed that she bled through her pants instead of leaving a meeting to get a tampon amid the high-pressure work culture at the company. In a recent report, former employees have cited 85 hours of meetings a week, lack of sleep and mental anguish as some of the things they faced at the company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: If cheap fuel is available, why won't we buy it?: FM on India buying Russian oil
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it made "perfect sense" for India to buy Russian oil if it's being offered at a discounted rate, especially amid inflation. She added, "I think we'll go ahead with what is good for the country. We need cheaper fuel. If it is available, why won't we want to buy it? We will buy it."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: PNB hikes interest rates on select term deposits by up to 60 bps
text: Punjab National Bank (PNB) will increase interest rates on term deposits in selected buckets by up to 60 basis points with effect from today. It has also increased the repo-linked lending rate (RLLR) from 6.5% to 6.9% with effect from June 1 for existing customers. The move comes after several banks raised interest rates following the RBI's repo rate hike.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Anil Agarwal sings bhajan with his mother on video call on Mother's Day
text: The daughter of billionaire Anil Agarwal took to Twitter to share a video of the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources singing a bhajan with his mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. "From feeding my belly with the most delicious ghee shakkar rotis, to helping me succeed in my goals...I owe it all to you, Maaji," Agarwal tweeted in reply.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jet Airways CEO lists 'things to avoid' for airlines after experience with foreign airline
text: Newly-appointed Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor shared a list of what airlines should avoid. It was based on his recent travel experience in Europe. "Things to avoid- 1) Staff travellers...checking in at business class counter, holding up the line. 2) Having to remind...non-smiling, no greeting agent to put priority tag. 3) Poor priority boarding process for stairs gate," he wrote.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Tata Group Chairman buys house he was living on rent for 5 yrs for ₹98 crore
text: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran and his family have purchased a duplex worth ₹98 crore in Mumbai's Pedder Road. The family had been residing in the duplex on lease for the last five years. Situated on the 11th and 12th floor of a 28-storey building, the family has reportedly been paying a monthly rent of ₹20 lakh for that house.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Anand Mahindra gifts a house to TN's 'Idli Amma' on Mother's Day; shares video
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra gifted a house to Tamil Nadu's M Kamalathal on the occasion of Mother's Day. Kamalathal, who is fondly known as 'Idli Amma', has been cooking and selling idlis for ₹1 for the past 30 years. "She's the embodiment of a Mother's virtues...A privilege to be able to support her and her work," Mahindra tweeted, sharing her video.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI rate hike wasn't surprising, its timing was: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the recent interest rate hike by the RBI was not surprising for her but its timing was. "It came as a surprise because it came between two monetary policy reviews," she added. For the first time since August 2018, RBI on May 4 raised its key lending rate by 40 basis points to 4.40%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: HDFC hikes home loan rates by 30 bps after RBI's repo rate hike
text: HDFC on Saturday raised its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on home loans by 30 basis points, which will be effective from May 9. Earlier, the lender had increased its benchmark lending rate by 5 basis points. Notably, the Reserve Bank of India hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points earlier this week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: ED staff threatened top executives with physical violence during probe: Xiaomi
text: Xiaomi alleged that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during questioning by Enforcement Directorate. It said that its India MD Manu Kumar Jain, current Financial Officer Sameer and their families were warned by ED officials of "dire consequences" if they didn’t submit the statements needed by them. ED had seized Xiaomi's ₹5,551 crore assets over forex violations recently.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet Airways granted security clearance by Home Ministry
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs has granted security clearance to Jet Airways which is planning to relaunch commercial flight operations in the next few months, PTI reported citing an official document. The Jalan-Kalrock Consortium-led airline operated a test flight in Hyderabad last Thursday. It will now conduct proving flights, following which the DGCA will grant it the air operator certificate.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Top Infibeam executive R Srikanth, wife murdered by driver in Chennai after US return
text: R Srikanth, the head of corporate finance at finance company Infibeam, and his wife Anuradha were murdered by their driver Krishna in Mylapore in Chennai on Saturday. Srikanth and Anuradha had just returned to India after visiting their daughter in US. Krishna was arrested from Andhra Pradesh while attempting to escape to Nepal with some looted items in a car.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Loans worth ₹5,000cr approved for women, SC/ST entrepreneurs in FY22
text: More than 23,000 loans, worth around ₹5,000 crore, were sanctioned during FY22 to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs under the government's Stand-Up India scheme, government data showed. As of March 31, 2022, a total of 1.35 lakh applications amounting to around ₹30,200 crore were sanctioned. The scheme was launched in April 2016.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Future Enterprises to raise ₹3,000 cr from insurance arm sale: Report
text: Debt-ridden Future Enterprises is planning to raise ₹3,000 crore by selling its insurance business to pare debts and avoid going into insolvency, reports said. FEL will reportedly sell its remaining 25% stake in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) for ₹1,250 crore. It may also sell its 33.3% stake in Life Insurance JV-Future Generali India Life Insurance (FGILICL) for ₹400 crore.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 cr to 14 states
text: The Centre on Friday released ₹7,183 crore as Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, including West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan and Punjab. This was the second monthly instalment of the PDRD grant. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹14,367 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total grant of ₹86,201 crore for FY23.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: We don't need to  acquire new assets to grow: Tata Steel MD
text: Tata Steel MD and CEO TV Narendran said the firm will look to grow organically and doesn't "really need to acquire new assets to grow [output]". "We will rely more on organic growth during this decade," Narendran said. "Right now, costs are stable, so steel prices are stable. We are comfortable with that," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata Projects shortlisted for Noida airport construction
text: Tata Projects has been shortlisted to construct the terminal, runway and various other airside and landside facilities at the Noida International Airport in Jewar. As per reports, Tata Projects scored higher than other bidders, Larsen & Toubro and Shapoorji Pallonji Group, under the quality and cost-based selection criteria. It might reportedly get the contract after two-three weeks.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Pushp Kumar Joshi takes over as HPCL Chairman & MD
text: Pushp Kumar Joshi on Sunday took over as the new Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), India's third-largest oil refining and fuel marketing company. Prior to this, Joshi was the Director-HR of the state-owned firm. He has replaced Mukesh Kumar Surana, who was superannuated from services on April 30, 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: FPI ownership in equities falls to 19.5%, lowest since March 2019
text: Foreign portfolio investors' (FPIs) ownership in domestic equities of NSE500 companies fell to 19.5% in March 2022, according to Bank of America Securities India. This is its lowest level of FPI ownership since March 2019, when it was at 19.3%. FPI ownership was at its peak at 21.4% in December 2021. FPI ownership in March 2022 stood at $619 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: L&T Infotech announces merger with Mindtree
text: Larsen & Toubro Infotech (L&T Infotech) on Friday announced that its board has approved a scheme of amalgamation and arrangement with Mindtree. Under the scheme, L&T Infotech will issue 73 shares for every 100 shares of Mindtree. After the completion of the merger, Larsen & Toubro Limited will hold a 68.73% stake in 'LTIMindtree', the combined entity.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance Industries becomes 1st Indian firm to hit $100 billion revenue in a year
text: Reliance Industries on Friday reported a net profit of ₹60,705 crore on a gross revenue of ₹7.92 lakh crore ($102 billion) for the full fiscal 2021-22, making it the first Indian company to hit $100-billion revenue mark. "Despite the ongoing challenges of the pandemic and heightened geo-political uncertainties, Reliance has delivered a robust performance," its Chairman Mukesh Ambani said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's COVID-19 death numbers quite a bit lower than rich countries: Bill Gates
text: India's COVID-19 death numbers are "quite a bit lower than rich countries", Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said in an interview with Times Now. He, however, admitted that there is "some debate over what those numbers are". On being asked how he would rate India's COVID-19 response on a scale of 1-10, Gates said, "I'll give India seven or eight."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Musk told investors he could double their money if they backed Twitter deal: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors that he was highly confident he could double or triple their money if they backed his $44 billion buyout of Twitter, as per a report. He reportedly also said he could double Twitter's users to over 500 million by 2025. Musk is said to temporarily serve as Twitter CEO after the deal is closed.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Xiaomi allowed to operate seized assets worth ₹5,551 crore by K'taka HC
text: Karnataka High Court has stayed the ED's decision to seize ₹5,551.27 crore from Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's bank accounts for suspected violations of foreign exchange laws. The court has allowed Xiaomi to operate its seized accounts for day to day activities. The company earlier said its "royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Swiggy agent books Dunzo to deliver man's order in B'luru, chat goes viral
text: A Twitter user in Bengaluru shared a screenshot of his chat where he revealed that while he had ordered coffee via Swiggy, the delivery agent booked a Dunzo delivery partner to deliver the item. Reacting to his tweet that is now going viral, Dunzo replied, "In the @peakbengaluru metaverse of madness, Bichoo gang and Eagle gang work together."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: L&T lnfotech CEO quits citing personal reasons as Mindtree merger announced
text: Larsen & Toubro lnfotech on Friday said that its CEO and Managing Director Sanjay Jalona has resigned from his position due to personal reasons. The development comes after L&T lnfotech announced its board has approved its merger with Mindtree. "Jalona has done a lot for the company and we are proud of him," Larsen & Toubro CEO SN Subrahmanyan said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Which investors are giving Musk over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter?
text: Elon Musk has secured a new financing commitment of $7.139 billion for his $44 billion Twitter buyout. Investors include Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Brookfield, Fidelity, Qatar Holding, Sequoia Capital Fund, Aliya Capital, Honeycomb & Vy Capital among others. Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who initially opposed the buyout, has agreed to roll his $1.89 billion stake into the deal.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Airtel broadband suffers outage in parts of Delhi, Bengaluru & other cities
text: Several users took to Twitter after Airtel broadband services suffered a major outage in parts of Delhi and nearby cities on Friday night. While Airtel is yet to issue an official statement on this, reports say the services were also hit in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Jaipur and Hyderabad. According to website outage monitoring platform DownDetector.com, the outage affected millions of users.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk denies Trump 'encouraged' him to buy Twitter, says 'had no communication'
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to react to a report that quoted Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes who said that Donald Trump had "encouraged" Musk to buy Twitter. Musk tweeted, "This is false. I’ve had no communication, directly or indirectly, with Trump, who has publicly stated that he will be exclusively on Truth Social."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zomato CEO to donate ESOP proceeds worth ₹700 cr for education of delivery agents' kids
text: Zomato's CEO Deepinder Goyal will be donating all his employee stock option plan (ESOP) proceeds worth ₹700 crore to Zomato Future Foundation (ZFF). ZFF will cover the education of up to two children of delivery agents of Zomato. This entails up to ₹50,000 cover per child annually for agents who have been with Zomato for more than five years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zomato shares hit an all-time low of ₹57.65; fall below issue price
text: Shares of Zomato dipped to an all-time low of ₹57.65 during intraday trade on Friday on BSE. While its issue price was ₹76, Zomato's stock price had touched an all-time high of ₹169.10 on November 16, 2021. Currently trading 66% below its all-time high price, Zomato shares have fallen over 57% on a year-to-date basis.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No plans to split auto business into 3 units: M&M denies restructuring reports
text: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) has denied reports claiming it has initiated a restructuring process to split its automobile business into three units. "There are no plans to split the auto business of the company into 3 units," M&M said on Friday. Earlier, reports said M&M is considering splitting up into an electric vehicle, a tractor and a passenger vehicle business.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Price of 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder increased by ₹50
text: The price of 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from today. The domestic cylinder will now cost ₹999.50. Earlier this month, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50. In April, the price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹250.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Govt orders all imported coal-based units to run at full capacity amid high demand
text: The government has invoked Section 11 of Electricity Act, mandating all imported coal-based power units to run at full capacity amid the ongoing power crisis in the country. "The demand for power has gone up by almost 20% in energy terms. The supply of domestic coal has increased but...it's not sufficient to meet increased demand for power," Power Ministry said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla to cover travel costs for staff seeking abortion amid Supreme Court draft leak
text: Tesla has said that it will cover travel costs for employees seeking out-of-state abortions amid a leaked draft of the US Supreme Court that would abolish a nationwide right to abortion. The company said it would also offer lodging support for those who may need to seek "healthcare services that are unavailable in their home state."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,400
text: The Sensex fell over 1,000 points to 54,668, while the NSE Nifty plunged 316 points to 16,366 during the intraday trade on Friday. Among the Sensex-30 shares, Bajaj Twins, Maruti, Wipro, Ultratech Cement, HCL Tech, Axis Bank, and Infosys were down up to 3%. Owing to weak global cues, the domestic markets had opened over 1.5% lower on Friday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt may privatise one of its 3 general insurers after LIC IPO launch: Report
text: After the launch of LIC's IPO, the Centre may privatise one of its general insurance companies this year, said a report. It detailed that by the time LIC is listed on stock exchanges, the government will start work to identify one of its three general insurers, namely, National Insurance Co., United India Insurance Co. and Oriental India Insurance for privatisation.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Reliance Jio Q4 net profit rises 24% to ₹4,173 cr, revenue hits ₹20,901 cr
text: Reliance Jio Infocomm, the telecom unit of Reliance Industries, on Friday reported a standalone net profit of ₹4,173 crore for the quarter ended March 31, up 24.2% from ₹3,360 crore during the same quarter in the previous year. The company's revenue for the fourth quarter of the financial year rose from ₹17,358 crore in March 2021 quarter to ₹20,901 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance Industries' net profit rises 22.4% year-on-year to ₹16,203 crore in Q4
text: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries on Friday reported a 22.4% year-on-year rise in its consolidated net profit for Q4 2022 at ₹16,203 crore. The company's revenue from operations rose 36.79% to ₹2,11,887 crore, compared with ₹1,54,896 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Reliance further said that its board has recommended an annual dividend of ₹8 per equity share.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Alibaba briefly loses $26 bn in market value after a man surnamed 'Ma' is held
text: The arrest of a man surnamed 'Ma' in China led to shares of Jack Ma's Alibaba falling by almost 10% on May 3, briefly erasing about $26 billion of market value. The state-run media had reported that the man was arrested for alleged national security violations. Alibaba’s shares recovered after the police clarified it wasn’t Jack Ma who was arrested.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: You set high benchmark: Jet Airways' CEO as IndiGo congratulates it on test flight
text: After IndiGo congratulated Jet Airways on its test flight on Thursday, Jet Airways' CEO Sanjiv Kapoor thanked its competitor airline and said, "You guys have set the benchmark really high." He added, "[You've] shown what's achievable by an (Indian) airline...in terms of size, scale and consistency of operations with...focus on basics." Jet Airways is in the process of relaunching operations.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Tesla asks India team to work for APAC amid high import duty: Report
text: US-based electric carmaker Tesla has reportedly asked its Indian team to start working for the Asia-Pacific market as import duties here remain high despite Tesla working for a tax break since 2019. Most employees have travelled to Dubai and are working for the Middle East markets, ET reported. Currently, India charges a 100% import duty on EVs worth over $40,000.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India expects to seal FTA with EU by next year: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that India will be able to conclude a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU) by next year. India is also negotiating FTAs with the UK, Canada and Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), he added. The FTAs will push growth in India and create more jobs as well, he further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: TVS elevates Sudarshan Venu as Managing Director
text: Sudarshan Venu, son of Venu Srinivasan, on Thursday took over as the Managing Director of TVS Motor Company. Sudarshan was earlier the joint MD of the firm. Accepting his new role, Sudarshan said, "With the continued guidance of my father and Sir Ralf (TVS Chairman) and the support of the board...I look forward to further embracing the future of mobility."
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: US stocks fall after Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps
text: US stocks fell after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 50 bps on Wednesday, citing elevated inflation. While Nasdaq Composite fell 546.15 points to 12,418.70 and registered a 4.21% drop, S&P 500 fell 130.19 points to 4,169.98 and registered a 3.03% drop in the early hours of trading. Dow Jones Industrial Average also fell 2.58% to touch 33,182.33 points.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Oil crosses $110 mark after EU plans phased ban on Russian oil
text: Oil price on Thursday crossed the $110 mark after the European Union laid out plans to place a phased ban on all Russian oil imports. Brent crude rose 1.4% to $111.73/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose 1.2% to $109.11/barrel. "Today, we'll propose...a complete import ban on all Russian oil," EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said on Wednesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: I regret WhatsApp's $22 bn sale to Facebook: WhatsApp's ex-CBO Arora
text: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora tweeted, "I helped negotiate WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook (in 2014). Today, I regret it." He said, "Our stance was very clear: No mining user data, No ads (ever), No cross-platform tracking...Of course, that's not what happened." He added, "Today...WhatsApp is a shadow of the product we poured our hearts into."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk secures over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter
text: World's richest man Elon Musk has secured $7.139 billion in new financing commitments for the acquisition of Twitter, a company filing showed on Thursday. The investors who committed financing include the world's largest crypto exchange Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital Fund among others. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bank of England warns of recession in the UK, hikes interest rates to 1%
text: The Bank of England on Thursday raised the interest rates by 25 bps to 1%, the highest since 2009.  The move is aimed at countering the inflation that's now heading above 10%. The Bank of England also sent a warning that the UK economy risks sliding into recession later this year amid higher energy prices pushing inflation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps in the biggest hike in 22 years
text: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark overnight interest rate by 50 bps, citing elevated inflation. It's the second hike in two months by the US Fed and the largest increase since 2000, which brings the key rate to a range of 0.75% to 1%. US inflation reached 6.6% last month, the highest point in four decades.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC gets fully subscribed
text: LIC's IPO, India's biggest ever, was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding on Thursday.   The ₹20,557-crore IPO, with price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, received bids for 16.24 crore equity shares against the offer size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholder portion was subscribed 3.02 times, employee portion 2.14 times, and retail investors subscribed 91%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: How will the RBI's repo rate hike affect loan EMIs and FD rates?
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the repo rate has been increased by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. This can lead to banks hiking EMI rates of home, auto or personal loans. The repo rate hike can however mean better returns for FD (Fixed Deposit) investors on new FDs.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Facebook became Frankenstein monster, devoured user data: WhatsApp's ex-CBO
text: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora, who regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, tweeted, "Nobody knew in the beginning that Facebook would become a Frankenstein monster that devoured user data and spat out dirty money." He added, "We didn’t either." Arora also said, "Tech companies need to admit when they have done wrong."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk plans to take Twitter public again 3 years after buyout: Report
text: World's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion and to take it private, could take the company public again after a few years, WSJ reported. Musk reportedly told potential investors that he plans to take Twitter public in as little as three years of buying it. Twitter's IPO took place in November 2013.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk may become temporary Twitter CEO after buyout deal closes: Report
text: Elon Musk is expected to serve as Twitter's temporary CEO for a few months after he completes Twitter's $44 billion buyout, CNBC reported. Parag Agrawal is Twitter's current CEO after taking over the role from Co-founder Jack Dorsey in November 2021. A few days ago, Agrawal responded, "Nope! we're still here," to a Twitter user who thought Agrawal was fired.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Why is LIC  being sold at a throwaway price?: Rahul Gandhi on LIC IPO
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the PM Narendra Modi-led government of "undervaluing" LIC, and questioned, "Why is one of India's most valuable assets being sold at a throwaway price?" India's largest-ever IPO of LIC, where the government is selling its 3.5% stake, expects to raise ₹20,557 crore. The LIC issue was fully subscribed on Thursday, the second day of bidding.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investors lose ₹6.27 lakh crore as Sensex crashes 1,300 points after repo rate hike
text: Investors lost ₹6.27 lakh crore on Wednesday after the Sensex ended 1,306 points lower, at 55,669, after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. The broader NSE Nifty tanked 392 points to finish at 16,678. Bajaj Finance was the biggest loser in the Sensex pack, followed by Bajaj Finserv, Titan, IndusInd Bank and HDFC Bank.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LIC IPO subscribed 63% on Day 1; staff, policyholder portions fully subscribed
text: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC was subscribed 63% till 5:06 pm on the first day of bidding on Wednesday. The LIC policyholders led the initial bout of buying in LIC's IPO as they subscribed 1.84 times the portion reserved for them. The employee reserved portion has subscribed 104% while the retail investors' portion has been subscribed 56%, Moneycontrol reported.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt plans to cut taxes on edible oils to curb rising prices: Report
text: The government is planning to cut taxes on some edible oils to curb the rising prices, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Prices of edible oil have soared in the country after the war in Ukraine and Indonesia's ban on palm oil exports. India is reportedly looking to slash the agriculture infrastructure and development cess on crude palm oil imports from 5%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: EU chief proposes phased ban on all Russian oil imports
text: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday proposed a phased oil embargo on Russia, sanctions on its top bank and a ban on Russian broadcasters from European airwaves. "Today, we will propose to ban all Russian oil from Europe. This will be a complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined," Leyen said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Looking into other options to deal with EU's ban on oil imports: Russia
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov has said that they are "looking into different options" after European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen proposed a ban on all oil imports from Russia. Leyen said, "This will be...complete import ban on all Russian oil-seaborne and pipeline, crude and refined." "Putin must pay...a high price for his brutal aggression," she added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Meta freezes hiring for 2022 after slow revenue growth: Report
text: Facebook-parent Meta has temporarily stopped hiring for the remainder of 2022 and is lowering hiring targets, Reuters reported citing Business Insider. This comes after Meta last week recorded its slowest revenue growth in a decade. "In light of the expense guidance given for this earnings period, we are slowing [talent] growth accordingly," a Meta spokesperson said in an e-mailed statement.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Zomato shares hit record low of ₹64, fall over 7% on Wednesday
text: Shares of food delivery giant Zomato hit a new record low of ₹64 as they fell 7.13% to close at ₹64.5 on Wednesday. Zomato has wiped out over half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock price hit a high of ₹142.45. Zomato had launched its IPO in July 2021 with a price band of ₹72-76.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Pfizer opens Asia's 1st global drug development centre in Chennai
text: US pharmaceutical company Pfizer on Wednesday launched a global drug research and development centre at the IIT Madras Research Park in Chennai at an initial investment of ₹150 crore. The 61,000-square-foot facility is among 12 centres established worldwide and the first in Asia. It employs 250 scientists and technicians, and would develop and support products in global markets, Pfizer said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC IPO booked 67% on day 1; policyholder share subscribed 1.99 times
text: LIC IPO was subscribed 67% on the first day of bidding on Wednesday, with investors bidding for 10.8 crore shares, compared with the total 16.2 crore shares on offer. While the policyholders' share was subscribed 1.99 times, employees' portion was subscribed 1.17 times. "The demand seems to be quite good...RBI rate hike...will have a limited impact," an expert told Reuters.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India may curb wheat exports as record heat damages crop: Report
text: India, which experienced its hottest March on record, is considering restricting wheat exports as severe heatwaves have damaged crops, Bloomberg reported. As per its source, the government might boost domestic supply by setting a minimum export price. This comes as the Food Ministry on Wednesday reduced its estimate of wheat output this season to 105 million tonnes.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Raids on Chinese firms linked to 'spy' Luo Sang's arrest: Report
text: The crackdown on Chinese firms like Huawei and Xiaomi by enforcement agencies is linked to the arrest of Chinese national Luo Sang, who is accused of spying for China, ANI reported. The Income Tax Department had caught Sang alias Charlie Peng in raids related to a ₹1,000 crore Hawala network in 2020. Both Huawei and Xiaomi have denied the allegations.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani's Mumbai International Airport raises $750 mn from Apollo
text: Adani Enterprises said its subsidiary Mumbai International Airport Ltd (MIAL), which runs the Mumbai airport, has raised $750 million senior secured private placement notes from Apollo-managed credit funds. The proceeds will be used to refinance existing shorter maturity loans and new capital expenditure, it added. In March, Adani Enterprises concluded financing of its Navi Mumbai airport.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI Governor warns of inflation, higher edible oil prices
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has warned that edible oil prices may go further up despite the central bank hiking the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. He said it was due to export restrictions by key producing countries and the loss of sunflower oil output amid Russia-Ukraine war. "Looking ahead, food inflation pressures are likely to continue," he stated.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India excludes 1,157 products from free trade pact with UAE
text: India has excluded as many as 1,157 products, including TVs, picture tubes, soaps, toys, footwear, sharbat and petroleum waxes from the ambit of India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). As per the FAQs prepared by the Commerce Ministry, India won't provide any customs duty concessions on these products given the sensitivities of these products for the domestic industry.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: This rate hike was needed: Uday Kotak on repo rate hiked to 4.40%
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak has said the Reserve Bank of India's decision to hike the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% is justified. "I think this rate hike was needed and I'm glad that they have acted intra-market and intra policy," Kotak stated. He added that the bank will be transmitting the rate hike to its borrowers.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's services exports set new record of $254.4 billion in FY22
text: Commerce Ministry on Wednesday said India's services exports set a new record of $254.4 billion (over ₹19 lakh crore) in FY22. It added that services exports also hit an all-time monthly high of $26.9 billion in March 2022. The top contributors to the exports were transport, telecommunications and computer and information services, the Ministry added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI hike to increase SBI's lending rate by 0.02%: SBI Chairman
text: SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara has said that the 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40% will increase SBI's marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by two basis points. He further said that the removal of excess liquidity from the market will "improve the pricing of loans". As per RBI's announcement, liquidity worth ₹87,000 crore could be withdrawn.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI increases repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday announced that the monetary policy committee has unanimously decided to increase the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40% with immediate effect. Das said that the decision was made after reassessing the inflation growth dynamics and macroeconomic situation. Consequently, the standing deposit facility rate stands adjusted to 4.15%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to 55,846 after RBI hikes repo rate to 4.40%
text: Sensex tanked over 1,000 points and was trading at 55,846 on Wednesday after the RBI announced a hike in the repo rate by 40 bps to 4.40%. The Nifty 50 was also down over 330 points and was trading at around 16,736. "We must remain in readiness to use policy tools to preserve macro stability," RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's richest man's Adani Wilmar buys multiple food brands including 'Kohinoor' rice
text: India's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar announced the acquisition of several brands, including the 'Kohinoor' brand from McCormick Switzerland GMBH. The financial details of the deal were undisclosed. The deal gives Adani Wilmar exclusive rights over the 'Kohinoor' basmati rice brand and 'Ready to Cook', 'Ready to Eat' curries & meals portfolio under the Kohinoor Brand umbrella in India.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: GST on online gaming may be raised from 18% to 28%: Reports
text: The Group of Ministers has recommended casinos, racecourses and online gaming shall be taxed under the 28% GST slab, reports said on Tuesday. Currently, online gaming is taxed at 18% of the platform fee, which works out to 5-20% of the contest entry amount. Chance gaming like racing, betting and lotteries are taxed at 28% of the contest entry amount.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's largest IPO of LIC opens for subscription
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO, which is India's largest, opened for subscription today. The price band of the IPO is ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will close for subscription on May 9.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk planning to put less of his money into buying Twitter: Report
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion last month, is "tying up less of his wealth in the deal", Reuters reported. Musk is in talks with large investment firms and high net-worth individuals for the financing. The new financing, if secured, could reduce the $21 billion cash contribution committed by Musk.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter may charge slight fee for commercial, government users: Musk
text: Elon Musk has said that Twitter will always be free for casual users but may charge a slight fee for commercial and government users. After the Tesla CEO struck a deal to buy Twitter, he said he wanted to enhance the platform with new features, make the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeat spam bots, and authenticate all humans.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Delhivery IPO likely to open on May 11, firm to raise ₹5,235 cr: Report
text: The initial public offering (IPO) of logistics startup Delhivery is likely to open for subscription on May 11 and close on May 13, Moneycontrol reported citing senior bankers. The Gurugram-based startup now plans to raise ₹5,235 crore through the IPO, down from the ₹7,460 crore planned earlier, Moneycontrol added. The offer will reportedly comprise a fresh issue of ₹4,000 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Another Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight faces technical issue, returns to Chennai
text: A Durgapur-bound SpiceJet flight had to return to Chennai after take-off last night due to a technical issue, a SpiceJet spokesperson told the Hindustan Times. The flight reportedly took off after a delay of 6.5 hours. The incident comes after another SpiceJet flight to Durgapur from Mumbai was hit by severe turbulence on Sunday in which 40 people were injured.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We thought it was the last day of our life, I'll never fly again: 22-yr-old SpiceJet flyer
text: A 22-year-old passenger named Imamul Ansari onboard Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet aircraft that encountered severe turbulence said, "We thought it was going to be the last day of our life. I'll never board a flight again." He added, "This was my first flight experience, and it landed me in hospital." He suffered a fracture in right-hand finger and injuries in his back.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Error by a Citi trader briefly wipes out $315 billion from stocks in Europe
text: The sudden plunge in European shares which was driven by a brief crash in Nordic markets was caused by a single sell order trade by Citigroup, Reuters reported. Citigroup said one of their traders in London made an error while inputting a transaction. The sudden plunge in the market briefly wiped out $315 billion from European stocks.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 'I have had my share of disappointments': RBI Governor quotes Mahatma Gandhi
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who on Wednesday announced the repo rate is being hiked by 40 bps to 4.40%, quoted Mahatma Gandhi during his address. "As Mahatma Gandhi said: "I have had my share of disappointments, uttermost darkness, but I am able to say that my faith has ultimately conquered every one of these difficulties"," Das said during his address.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,300 points to end at 55,669 after repo rate hiked to 4.40%
text: The stock benchmarks fell the most in over eight weeks on Wednesday after the RBI announced a 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40%. While the Sensex tanked 1,306 points to close at 55,669, the Nifty 50 tanked 392 points to close at 16,678. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance were among the top index losers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Aurobindo Pharma gets USFDA nod for generic cancer treatment drug
text: Hyderabad-based Aurobindo Pharma said its wholly-owned arm Eugia Pharma Specialties Ltd has received approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) for its generic Bortezomib drug. It is used to treat adult patients with multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma. The approved product has a market size of $1.172 billion for the year ended March 2022, the company said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SII's Covovax now available for children in India: Poonawalla
text: SII's COVID-19 vaccine Covovax is now available for children, CEO Adar Poonawalla said on Tuesday. A dose of Covovax for children aged 12-17 will cost ₹900, in addition to hospital service charge of ₹150, PTI reported. "This is the only vaccine manufactured in India that is also sold in Europe and has an efficacy of over 90%," Poonawalla added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Activision shares rise after Buffett reveals owning 9.5% stake
text: Shares of Activision Blizzard rose nearly 3% on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway owned a 9.5% stake worth $5.6 billion in the video game maker. Activision shares were up $2.13, or 2.8%, at $77.73. However, this was still lower than the $95/share Microsoft offered as part of its $68.7 billion proposal to buy Activision.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC IPO undervalued, shares being offered at throwaway prices: Cong
text: Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala on Tuesday said the LIC IPO is undervalued and that shares are being offered at throwaway prices. Surjewala also asked why LIC's valuation was reduced from ₹12-14 lakh crore to ₹6 lakh crore in just two months. "Why is government trying to sell LIC when domestic and global financial markets are in turmoil?" Surjewala said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Amazon doubles export target from India to $20 billion by 2025
text: Amazon on Wednesday promised to export locally produced Indian goods worth $20 billion by 2025, doubling its $10 billion-goal set in 2020 for the same time frame. The company's 'Global Selling' programme has attracted over 1,00,000 exporters since its launch in 2015 in India, it added. In 2021, over 1,000 Indian exporters on the programme crossed ₹1 crore in sales.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Hope to swiftly conclude talks on India-EU Free Trade Agreement: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he hopes that negotiations on the India-EU Free Trade Agreement will be concluded swiftly. Speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen, PM Modi said, "We stressed on the need to ensure a free, open, inclusive and rules-based Indo-Pacific region." We also appealed for a ceasefire in Ukraine, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt sets 19-million-tonnes coal import target for end-June: Report
text: The Centre has asked state and private-sector power utilities to ensure delivery of 19 million tonnes of coal from overseas by end-June, Reuters reported citing a letter from the Power Ministry. Public-sector utilities have been asked to import over 22 million tonnes of coal, while private-sector utilities have been asked to import a total of 15.94 million tonnes of coal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's GDP to not reach $5 trillion before FY29: IMF data
text: India may only become a $5-trillion economy in FY29, data from IMF's World Economic Outlook Database suggested. As per the data, which doesn't go beyond FY28, India's nominal GDP is seen rising to $4.92 trillion in FY28. Earlier this year, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran had said India would become a $5-trillion economy by FY26 or the following year.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Merchandise exports rise 24.2% to $38 bn in April, imports grow 26.6%
text: India's merchandise exports rose 24.22% YoY from $30.75 billion in April 2021 to $38.19 billion in April 2022, Commerce Ministry's preliminary data showed. Imports in April 2022 grew 26.55% YoY to $58.26 billion while trade deficit widened to $20.07 billion against $15.29 billion in April 2021. Petroleum and crude products accounted for 33.5% of imports in April this year.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI hikes cash reserve ratio by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21 onwards
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Wednesday said the monetary policy committee has decided to hike the cash reserve ratio (CRR) by 50 bps to 4.5% from May 21. Withdrawal of liquidity due to the hike could be to the order of ₹87,000 crore. Average surplus liquidity in the banking system was at over ₹7 lakh crore in April, Das said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CCPA calls meeting with Ola, Uber over several user complaints
text: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has called a meeting of ride-hailing platforms like Ola and Uber following a "very high" number of complaints from customers. "The complaints [are] regarding the cancellation and pricing policy of cab aggregators," said CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare. She added that it appears that cab aggregators are using algorithms to lure new customers.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Cumin prices set to rise 30-35% to touch five-year high: Report
text: An estimated 35% decline in production in crop season 2021-22 that started in November is set to drive up cumin prices to a five-year high, ratings agency Crisil reported. As per its report, cumin prices are likely to rise up to 30-35% to reach ₹165-170 per kg. It further stated that cumin acreage this season fell by 21% year-on-year.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Always take your people with you: Anil Agarwal on secret to success
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared what he believes is the secret to his success. "I often get asked, 'How did you do it?' The answer is very simple. No matter how far you get in life, you must always take your people with you," Agarwal wrote. "You must empower your people to deliver their best," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Domestic mutual funds subscribe 71% of LIC IPO anchor book
text: Domestic mutual funds invested ₹4,002.27 crore, accounting for 71.12% of the total ₹5,627 crore that LIC IPO mobilised from anchor investors on Monday. The largest investor was SBI Mutual Fund, which invested ₹1,006.89 crore. Overall, LIC issued 59.29 million equity shares to 123 anchor investors at the upper price band of the offer of ₹949 per share.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.83% in April, Haryana tops list: Report
text: The unemployment rate in India rose to 7.83% in April 2022 from 7.60% in March 2022, according to data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). The highest unemployment rate of 34.5% was recorded in Haryana. It's followed by 28.8% in Rajasthan, 21.1% in Bihar, 15.6% in Jammu & Kashmir, 15.5% in Goa and 14.6% in Tripura.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Which are the world's top 15 places for long-term remote workers as per a research?
text: Lisbon is the best location for long-term remote workers, research by real estate services company Savills, listed on the London Stock Exchange, said. Lisbon is followed by Miami, Dubai, Algarve, Barbados, Barcelona, Dubrovnik, Saint Lucia, Malta, Antigua, Mauritius, Côte d'Azur, Cyprus, Tuscany and The Bahamas. "They offer favourable climates year-round and a high quality of life," Savills said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: New Zealand-founded IT company offers unlimited leave to employees
text: New Zealand-founded IT company Actionstep is offering its employees unlimited annual leave, The New Zealand Herald reported. "This way, it covers everything like sick leave, bereavement and maternity," Actionstep's VP of engineering, Stevie Mayhew, said. "We're a team, we trust each other and we believe our best work happens when life & work is in good balance," the company said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World-beating retail revolution, bravo: Mahindra to Nilekani on e-comm project
text: Anand Mahindra praised Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani for helping the government in building the open network for digital commerce (ONDC). "We're on the brink of a world-beating retail revolution," tweeted Mahindra. He added, "This will democratise e-commerce, liberating us from the dominance of a few giants & empowering millions of small shop owners...Bravo Nandan Nilekani."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Murdoch, Shankar's Bodhi Tree to invest $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute
text: Bodhi Tree, the investment firm backed by James Murdoch and former Disney executive Uday Shankar, is investing $600 million in ALLEN Career Institute. Bodhi Tree said that its investment in the 33-year-old test prep institute is strategic in nature. Founded by Rajesh Maheshwari in 1988, ALLEN operates 138 classroom centres in 46 cities across India and the Middle East.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fresh case against Mehul Choksi for cheating IFCI of ₹22 cr during 2014-2018: CBI
text: The CBI said it has filed a fresh case against fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi and his Gitanjali Gems for allegedly cheating government-run IFCI Limited of ₹22 crore between 2014 and 2018. Choksi allegedly approached IFCI seeking financial support for Gitanjali Gems and got it to sanction a ₹25 crore corporate loan in 2016. The company allegedly defaulted on loan repayments.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: You asked me to buy a stock when you were 14, it continued to rise: Musk's mom
text: Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk tweeted, "Elon, in South Africa, when you were 14, you asked me to buy a stock." She said, "My stockbroker said it's a bad idea...so I only bought...R1000 (similar to $1000 at that time)." Maye added, "The stock quickly rose to R3000...My stockbroker panicked and said I had to sell...and...I sold...That stock continued to rise."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Choksi pledged fake gemstones to secure ₹25 cr loan from govt-run IFCI: CBI
text: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi used "low-quality, lab-prepared chemical vapour diamonds" and other 'fake gemstones' to secure a ₹25 crore corporate loan from government-run IFCI, CBI has alleged. After his company, Gitanjali Gems, defaulted on the loan, it was found that their actual valuation was 98% less than shown by the company. He's accused of cheating IFCI of ₹22 crore.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Russian oligarch forced to sell 35% stake in firm for calling Ukraine war 'insane'
text: Russian oligarch, Oleg Tinkov, told The New York Times that he was forced to sell 35% stake in TCS Group Holdings, a company he founded, after he criticised Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I couldn't discuss the price. It was like a hostage," he said. Earlier, Tinkov had said, "I don't see a single beneficiary of this insane war (in Ukraine)."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Audi, Porsche have decided to join Formula 1: Volkswagen CEO
text: Volkswagen's premium brands Audi and Porsche have decided to join Formula One, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess confirmed on Monday. Porsche's preparations are a little more concrete, Diess, speaking on YouTube, added. It comes after Reuters reported in March that Audi is ready to offer $556.30 million for British luxury sports carmaker McLaren as a means to enter.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: UPI hits record high transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April
text: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) recorded 5.58 billion transactions in April 2022, a new all-time high for the payments platform since its launch in 2016, NPCI data revealed. In value terms, UPI saw transactions worth ₹9.83 lakh crore in April. This is a 3.3% jump in volume of transactions from March 2022 and a rise of 111% on a year-on-year basis.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Why option of merging Pawan Hans with ONGC wasn't explored?: Cong
text: Congress on Sunday questioned disinvestment of the Centre's 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited (PHL) and asked why the Centre didn't explore merging PHL with Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC). Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said the Centre is "committing a series of blunders" and that the Pawan Hans employee union had also recommended merging PHL with ONGC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Germany pledges €10 billion for bilateral cooperation with India
text: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Germany is pledging €10 billion (approximately ₹80,615 crore) for bilateral cooperation with India in the coming years. "When implementing the measures for these partnership projects, we will provide a great deal of funding over the next few years," Scholz said. This comes after PM Narendra Modi held talks with Scholz in Berlin today.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sri Lanka extends credit line with India by $200 million for fuel
text: Sri Lankan Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Monday said Sri Lanka has extended a credit line with India by $200 million in order to procure emergency fuel stocks. Sri Lanka is in talks to extend the credit line by an additional $500 million, Wijesekera said at a press conference. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Power Grid to buy IL&FS Energy Development Company's CPTCL stake
text: State-owned Power Grid Corporation of India will purchase IL&FS Energy Development Company Ltd's (IEDCL) equity shareholding in Cross Border Power Transmission Company Ltd (CPTCL), as per a regulatory filing. Currently, Power Grid owns 26% stake in CPTCL while 38% shareholding is with IEDCL. Meanwhile, Satluj Jal Vidyut Nigam (SJVN) owns 26% and Nepal Electricity Authority owns 10% stake.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC getting bids twice the size of its IPO anchor book: Report
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO is getting bids twice the size of its anchor book, Bloomberg reported. LIC's anchor book, which contains a list of institutional investors for its IPO, will be announced on Monday. Singapore's GIC Private Limited and Norway's sovereign wealth fund are reportedly among the list of anchor investors for LIC's ₹20,557-crore IPO.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Delhi replaces Dubai as world's 2nd busiest airport in March: Report
text: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport was the world's second busiest airport in March in terms of domestic and international flights, travel data provider Official Airline Guide (OAG) said in a report. While Atlanta retained its first position, Dubai slipped to third. The report said Atlanta, Delhi and Dubai airports handled 4.42 million, 3.61 million and 3.55 million seats respectively.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SBI gives no-dues certificate to farmer withheld over 31 paise
text: SBI on Monday told the Gujarat High Court that it has issued a no-dues certificate to a farmer after the court said not issuing the certificate over pending dues of 31 paise is "nothing but harassment". SBI added that it couldn't issue it earlier in view of a letter sent by the farmer asking it not to do so.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Direct investment in equities hit 6-month low in March
text: Direct retail investment in the equity market through the National Stock Exchange stood at ₹7,100 crore in March, the lowest inflow in more than six months, data showed. The net inflows from retail investors were down 49% month-on-month in March.  The dip came despite addition of over 9 million dematerialised accounts in the March quarter, data further revealed.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Suman Bery takes charge as NITI Aayog Vice Chairperson
text: Economist Dr Suman K Bery on Sunday took charge as the Vice Chairperson of NITI Aayog, according to an official statement. "NITI Aayog's challenge is to...work with India's states, which is where economic development ultimately happens," the statement quoted Bery as saying. Bery has replaced Dr Rajiv Kumar, who had taken over as the Vice Chairperson in 2017.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: World will hear 'Digital India Inside' instead of 'Intel Inside': MoS IT
text: Minister of State for Communications and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar, during Semicon India Conference 2022's last day, praised Centre's efforts in the semiconductor domain. "In the past, world heard Intel Inside. In the future, the world should hear Digital India Inside," he stated. He added that the government will examine the feedback it received over its Design Linked Incentive (DLI) Scheme.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC IPO anchor book oversubscribed; gets bids of over ₹7,000 cr
text: The anchor investor portion of LIC initial public offering (IPO) was oversubscribed on Monday, the first day of subscription. Reports said the portion received bids in excess of ₹7,000 crore against the offer of ₹5,630 crore for anchor investors out of a total offer size of ₹21,000 crore. Investors likely to have bid include Norges Bank and GIC among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Rajiv Ranjan replaces Mridul Saggar as MPC ex-officio member
text: The Board of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday approved the nomination of Executive Director Rajiv Ranjan as an ex-officio member of the monetary policy committee (MPC). Ranjan will replace Mridul Saggar, who is reportedly to retire by end of April. As per his LinkedIn profile, Ranjan was recently the head of the Department of Economic and Policy Research.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Gadkari pitches for priority lending for alternative fuels sector
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said firms involved in production or business of alternative fuels should be included in priority sector lending. "I shall speak about the issue with the Finance Minister and RBI Governor," Gadkari said. Priority sector lending will help such businesses to obtain loans from banks on easier terms, Gadkari added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's pharma exports hit ₹1.83 lakh crore in FY22: Govt
text: Pharma exports touched ₹1,83,422 crore in 2021-22 against ₹90,415 crore in 2013-14, a 103% rise in eight years, the Commerce Ministry said. It added that currently, 60% of the world's vaccines and 20% of generic medicines come from India. The pharma exports in FY22 sustained a positive growth despite trade disruptions and drop in demand for coronavirus-related medicines, it stated.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: K'taka govt clears 60 projects worth ₹2,466 cr, to create 8,575 jobs
text: The Karnataka government approved 60 new industrial projects worth ₹2,465.94 crore, which will generate over 8,575 jobs, during the 131st State-level single-window clearance committee (SLSWCC) meeting on Saturday. As per the official statement, 10 large and medium-size projects worth over ₹50 crore each, 49 projects worth ₹15 crore to ₹50 crore each and one ₹5 crore-project were cleared.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Fabindia gets SEBI's approval for raising funds through IPO
text: Lifestyle retail brand Fabindia has received market regulator SEBI's approval to raise funds through its IPO. According to Fabindia's draft red herring prospectus, its IPO includes fresh issue of shares worth upto ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of over 2.5 crore shares. The firm's promoters also plan to gift over seven lakh shares to artisans and farmers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹5,551 crore seized from Xiaomi India bank accounts for forex violations: ED
text: Assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited have been seized in connection with "illegal outward remittances made by the company", the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Saturday. The assets lying in bank accounts have been seized under provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999, the agency added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Jack Dorsey, Peter Thiel encouraged Musk to take Twitter private: WSJ
text: A group of "libertarian-leaning activists and businessmen", PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel, and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey encouraged Elon Musk to take Twitter private, the Wall Street Journal reported. Musk and Dorsey believed Twitter could be run more effectively as a private company and they focussed on its role as a potential public good, the WSJ said, quoting former executives.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos loses over $20 billion in a day
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos lost around $20.5 billion in a day after Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015, with net loss of $3.8 billion in first quarter of 2022. Bezos, the world's second richest person according to Bloomberg, is now reportedly the third biggest wealth loser this year, with his fortune dropping nearly $44 billion since January 1.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India's economy may take up to 13 years to recover from COVID-19 losses: RBI
text: India is expected to overcome the losses caused by the COVID-19 disruptions by 2034-35, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stated in its report on currency and financing released on Friday. It further stated, "India suffered among the biggest pandemic induced losses in the world in terms of output, lives and livelihoods...Economic activity has barely recovered...even after two years."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: GST collection hits all time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022
text: The GST revenue collection for April 2022 was at its highest ever at ₹1.68 lakh crore, Finance Ministry said. It's ₹25,000 crore more than the next highest collection of ₹1,42,095 crore in March 2022. Of the ₹1.68 lakh crore collected in April 2022, CGST is ₹33,159 crore, SGST is ₹41,793 crore, IGST is ₹81,939 crore and cess is ₹10,649 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder hiked by ₹102.50, will cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi
text: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50 on Sunday, reported ANI. The 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,355.50 in Delhi, which was earlier priced at ₹2,253. In Mumbai, the commercial LPG price was hiked to ₹2,307 from ₹2,205 per cylinder. In Kolkata and Chennai, a 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹2,455 and ₹2,508 respectively.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: If you offered me all the Bitcoin in the world for $25, I wouldn't take it: Buffett
text: Warren Buffett, the world's sixth richest person and Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, said if someone offered him all of the Bitcoin in the world for $25, he wouldn't take it. "What would I do with it? I'd have to sell it back to you one way or another," the 91-year-old added. Buffett also said that Bitcoin doesn't produce anything tangible.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Over $200 billion wiped off Amazon’s market value in its biggest 1-day drop since 2006
text: Amazon stock sank 14% in its biggest one-day drop since July 2006, with the shares closing on Friday at their lowest level since June 2020. With this, more than $200 billion was wiped off from the company's market valuation. This comes after the e-commerce giant reported quarterly loss for the first time in seven years.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Our royalty payments, bank statements are legit: Xiaomi as ED seizes ₹5,551 cr
text: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore "in connection with illegal outward remittances", the company said, "As a brand committed to India, all our operations are firmly compliant with local laws and regulations." Xiaomi further said, "We believe our royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ISMC to invest ₹22,900 crore to set up India's 1st chip-making plant in Karnataka
text: International semiconductor consortium ISMC will invest ₹22,900 crore ($3 billion) to set up India's first and largest semiconductor fabrication unit in Karnataka, the state government announced on Sunday. ISMC is a joint venture between Abu Dhabi's Next Orbit Ventures and Israel's Tower Semiconductor. The chip-making plant is expected to generate over 1,500 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Wipro plans to hire 38,000 freshers in FY23
text: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company hired over 19,000 freshers in FY22 and expects to double the number in FY23. Wipro added 45,416 employees on a year-on-year basis during the financial year, taking its total headcount to 2,43,128. The company said it plans to increase the frequency of promotion cycle for 70% employees in junior bands to quarterly basis.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Same Xiaomi allowed to donate ₹10 cr to PM-CARES Fund: Moitra on ED seizure
text: TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Saturday reacted to the Enforcement Directorate's seizure of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore over Forex law violations. Moitra said the same Xiaomi was earlier "allowed to donate ₹10 crore to opaque PM-CARES Fund". Notably, Congress had earlier questioned why PM Modi's COVID-19 fund was accepting donations from Chinese companies.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: I avoid things that are evil, stupid & make me look bad; Bitcoin does all 3: Munger
text: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice-Chairman Charlie Munger said, "I avoid things that are stupid, evil, and make me look bad in comparison to someone else." The billionaire added, "Bitcoin does all three." He said Bitcoin is "stupid" because he expects it to go to zero, "evil" because it undermines US financial system's integrity, and makes other countries "look foolish" compared to China.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Seized heroin appeared in Flipkart packaging: CAIT as it seeks probe against firm
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has sought an NCB investigation against Flipkart over its alleged role in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh drug racket busted by the NCB. "The seized heroin and other articles appeared in Flipkart packaging as per video and photos available on media," the CAIT said. "Flipkart's possible involvement in illegal activities...must not go unnoticed," it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hero Electric dispatched zero vehicles in April amid chip shortage
text: Hero Electric, India's largest electric two-wheeler manufacturer by volume, has reported zero dispatches in April 2022 due to the global chip shortage. "It's like putting an emergency brake on a fast-moving train. Our sales were almost doubling month on month and we somehow managed...but the (Russia-Ukraine) war collapsed a major supply chain, resulting in this disruption," CEO Sohinder Gill said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: World may face a recession within the next two years, warns Singapore PM
text: Singapore PM Lee Hsien Loong has warned that the world may face a recession within the next two years. Loong said that the Russia-Ukraine war has clouded Singapore's post-COVID-19 recovery outlook, adding that Singaporeans are already feeling the impact of the war on the cost of living. Singapore is facing an S$8 billion hit a year from higher energy prices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: EMIs to rise as HDFC hikes lending rate on housing loans
text: Mortgage lender HDFC has increased its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on housing loans, on which its Adjustable Rate Home Loans (ARHL) are benchmarked, by 5 basis points. The hiked rate, which will increase EMI for existing borrowers, comes into effect from May 1, 2022, HDFC Ltd said. There is no change in the lending for new borrowers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt to sell 51% stake in Pawan Hans to Star9 Mobility for ₹211 cr
text: The government has approved the sale of its 51% shareholding in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility Private Ltd for ₹211.14 crore. Star9 is a consortium of Big Charter Private Limited, Maharaja Aviation Private Limited and Almas Global Opportunity Fund SPC. The helicopter and aero mobility company has been incurring losses over the last three years, the Finance Ministry said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Gold price dips as dollar climbs to 20-year high
text: Gold price extended loss for second successive week, logging biggest monthly drop in April since September 2021. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold rate for June contract closed at ₹51,760 per 10 gram mark on Friday. As per experts, the dip came as dollar index sustained above 100 for entire week leading to USD climbing to 20-year high levels.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World's richest man Elon Musk shares investment advice for 'long-term'
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk shared investment advice after tweeting he's been "asked a lot" about it. "Buy stock in several companies that make products & services that *you* believe in...Only sell if you think their products & services are trending worse," Musk tweeted. He added, "Don't panic when the market does...This will serve you well in the long-term."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Khadi becomes 1st Indian FMCG firm to clock over ₹1 lakh crore turnover
text: Khadi & Village Industries Commission (KVIC) has clocked a record annual turnover of ₹1.15 lakh crore in 2021-22. With this, it has become the first and only FMCG company in the country to have recorded a turnover of over ₹1 lakh crore, the government said. KVIC's massive turnover comes despite partial lockdown due to second wave of COVID-19, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CBI raids 8 locations in Mumbai, Pune over Yes Bank-DHFL fraud case
text: CBI on Saturday conducted raids at eight locations in Mumbai and Pune in connection with a fraud case related to Yes Bank and Dewan Housing Finance Limited. Searches were conducted at the premises linked to Pune-based businessman Avinash Bhosale & Mumbai's prominent real estate developers Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. Reportedly, they've close links with the Shiv Sena-led Maharashtra government.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: LIC to retain some stake in IDBI Bank for bancassurance gains: Chairman
text: LIC will retain a part of its stake in IDBI Bank to reap the benefits of the bancassurance channel, Chairman MR Kumar said. He added that LIC doesn't want to "hold a big stake" but some holding as it has been a win-win for both entities. LIC had bought a 51% stake in IDBI Bank in 2019 for ₹21,624 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India has enough edible oil stock: Govt amid Indonesia's export ban
text: Amid Indonesia's palm oil export ban, the Centre said India has enough stock of edible oil. The present stock of all edible oils is around 21 lakh metric tonne (LMT) and another 12 LMT will arrive in May, the government added. Edible oils' prices are being watched closely so that appropriate measures can be taken to keep prices under control.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IDFC FIRST Bank's Q4 profit rises 168% year-on-year to ₹343 crore
text: IDFC FIRST Bank reported that its net profit for the quarter ended March 2022 surged 168% to ₹343 crore as compared to ₹128 crore in the year-ago period. This was driven by strong growth in core operating income and lower provisioning, the bank said. IDFC's profit for financial year 2021-22 stood at ₹145 crore, marking a year-on-year decline of 68%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Delhi-NCR 9th most costly office market in Asia-Pacific: Report
text: Delhi-NCR is the ninth most expensive prime office space market in Asia-Pacific with an occupancy cost of $60 per square feet per year, Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index for Q1 2022 revealed. The region's most expensive office markets are Hong Kong ($186) and Singapore ($105). Mumbai ($50.9) and Bengaluru ($26.7) are at 15th and 21st positions respectively.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Jet fuel price up 3.22%, reaches record high after 2022's 9th hike
text: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 3.22% on Sunday to an all-time high, reflecting a surge in global energy prices. ATF now costs ₹1,16,851.46/kl in Delhi, ₹1,15,617.24/kl in Mumbai, ₹1,21,430.48/kl in Kolkata and ₹1,20,728.03/kl in Chennai. ATF prices have increased by ₹42,829.55/kl, or over 50%, in nine consecutive hikes since January 1.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Twitter overcounted its users for 3 years due to an error
text: Twitter admitted it overcounted its monetisable daily active usage/users (mDAU) from Q1 2019 through Q4 2021. "In March 2019, we launched a feature to let people link multiple separate accounts together to conveniently switch between accounts," said Twitter. "An error was made at that time...actions taken via primary account resulted in all linked accounts being counted as mDAU," added Twitter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $170 billion wiped off Amazon's market value in its biggest drop since 2014
text: Shares of Amazon fell as much as 12% on Friday in its biggest intraday percentage drop since July 2014, wiping off about $170 billion from the company's market valuation. The company's shares declined after it reported a loss of $3.8 billion for Q1 2022, marking its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon also posted the slowest sales growth since 2001.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zomato shares hit all-time low, wipe out half of investor wealth in 4 months
text: Shares of Zomato hit an all-time low of ₹71.15 on Friday, slipping below the lower band of IPO price in nine months since its stock market debut. Zomato has wiped out almost half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock hit a high of ₹142.45. The food delivery platform's shares are down more than 15% this month.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: No such instruction: Govt on reports of halting electric 2-wheeler launches
text: The government has denied reports claiming it has asked electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated. "There is no such instruction and such reports are unfounded, misleading and far from the truth," the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways tweeted. Earlier reports said government also cautioned manufacturers who haven't reported any fire incidents.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zuckerberg's wealth increases by $11 billion in his biggest one-day gain ever
text: Meta Platforms' 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg added $11 billion to his fortune in the biggest one-day gain he has ever had, Bloomberg reported. His personal wealth surged as Meta shares soared 17.6% on Thursday after it reported that Facebook added more users than expected in first quarter of 2022. Zuckerberg is now the world's 12th-richest person with $75.9 billion wealth.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Apple may make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in India this fiscal: Report
text: Apple's contract manufacturers in India are expected to make iPhones worth ₹47,000 crore in FY23,  The Economic Times reported. This will be almost five times the ₹10,000 crore worth of iPhones made by Apple's contract manufacturers Foxconn and Wistron in India in FY22, the report added. Earlier this month, Apple's manufacturing partner Foxconn began making iPhone 13 in India.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nilekani helping govt build platform to take on Amazon, Flipkart: Report
text: Infosys' billionaire Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is helping the government build "a freely accessible online system where traders and consumers can buy and sell everything from detergent bars to airline tickets," Bloomberg reported. It is called the Open Network for Digital Commerce, or ONDC. Its objective is to curb Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart's domination in India, Bloomberg report added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Airbnb tells employees they can work remotely forever
text: Airbnb told its 6,000 employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely. The home-renting marketplace also told its US employees that they could move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky said that permanent flexibility will allow the company to "hire and retain the best people in the world".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $4 bn, says no further sales planned
