text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million Tesla shares worth nearly $4 billion, filings showed. Commenting on the sale he said, "No further TSLA sales planned after today." Earlier this week, Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that Musk may sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44-billion Twitter deal.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for me: Snapdeal CEO
text: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl said that Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani is India's Elon Musk for him. "Whether it's Infosys, Aadhaar, UPI and now ONDC (Open Network for Digital Commerce), his impact on India and its global standing is nothing short of incredible," Bahl tweeted. While Nilekani's personality is distinct compared to Musk's, the quantum of his impact isn't, he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fuel price hike lowest under PM Modi's regime: Union minister Hardeep Puri
text: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said fuel price hike under the PM Narendra Modi-led government had been the lowest. "Basic salaries have increased over decades...The government is giving free schemes to people under various categories," he added. "The PM has advocated for the best spirit of cooperative federalism pertaining to the issue of livelihoods," the minister said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: SBI denies no-dues certificate to farmer over 31 paise in Gujarat
text: The Gujarat High Court criticised SBI for withholding no-dues certificate of a farmer for pending dues worth 31 paise. The farmer needed the certificate for a land deal after he repaid the crop loan, TOI reported. "Outstanding of 31 paise? Do you know anything less than 50 paise is to be ignored?" Justice Bhargav Karia told SBI.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BJP claims 8 of the top 10 states with highest fuel prices are non-BJP ruled states
text: BJP has shared a list claiming that eight of the top 10 states with highest petrol and diesel prices in the country are non-BJP ruled states. According to BJP, Andhra Pradesh occupies the top spot where petrol was sold at ₹121.4/litre and diesel at ₹107/ litre on April 6. Madhya Pradesh and Bihar are also included in the list.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Nithin Kamath's fake Insta ID used to scam user, he shares screenshot
text: Zerodha CEO and co-founder Nithin Kamath recently warned people of various types of frauds he has encountered and used his fake account as an example. He shared a screenshot of the fake Instagram page trying to scam a user with a "crypto scheme" promising to generate $10,000 in a week. "Phishing frauds' [number] has gone through the roof," he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Amazon reports its first quarterly loss since 2015, loses $3.8 billion
text: E-commerce giant Amazon reported its first quarterly loss since 2015. Amazon's net loss for the first quarter of 2022 was $3.8 billion. "It...includes a pre-tax valuation loss of $7.6 billion included in non-operating expense from our common stock investment in Rivian Automotive," Amazon said. "Pandemic and subsequent war in Ukraine...brought unusual growth and challenges," CEO Andy Jassy stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I dedicate my last years to health: Tata at inauguration of Assam cancer hospitals
text: Ratan Tata, who accompanied PM Narendra Modi in inaugurating cancer hospitals in Assam on Thursday, said, "I dedicate my last years to health...Make Assam a state that recognises and is recognised by all." Earlier this year, the 84-year-old industrialist was conferred Assam's highest civilian award 'Assam Baibhav'. PM Modi on Thursday inaugurated seven cancer hospitals in Assam.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LIC likely to list shares on exchanges on May 17
text: The shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) are likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which will be India's biggest ever, will open for subscription on May 4 and close on May 9. The government is expecting to raise ₹20,557 crore by diluting its 3.5% stake through the IPO.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk said he'll cut jobs at Twitter while securing bank loans for buyout: Reports
text: Elon Musk told banks he will crackdown on the salaries of Twitter executives and board members and develop new ways to monetise tweets, Reuters reported, quoting people familiar with the matter. Musk specifically mentioned job cuts as a part of his pitch to the banks to secure debt for the buyout, reports said. He took Twitter private for $44 billion.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Meta reports 21% drop in profits in 2nd straight quarterly decline
text: Facebook parent Meta reported a 21% y-o-y decline in its profit for Q1 2022 at $7.5 billion, marking the company's second consecutive quarterly decline. Meta's revenue however grew 7% to $27.91 billion from $26.17 billion. Meanwhile, Facebook's daily active user count also increased 4% y-o-y to 1.96 billion after declining in Q4 2021 for the first time.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Twitter reports revenue miss, user growth for Q1 days after Musk deal
text: Days after agreeing to sell to Elon Musk for $44 billion, Twitter released its earnings report for Q1 2022 on Thursday. Its daily active users number was up by 15.9% y-o-y to 229 million, compared with analysts' estimates of 226.8 million. However, Twitter's revenue was slightly below the estimated $1.23 billion. It earned $1.2 billion, an increase of 16% y-o-y.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Meta's shares surge 19% as Facebook reports user growth in Q1 2022
text: Facebook-parent Meta's shares surged 19% during pre-market trading in New York, a day after it reported that Facebook added more users than projected in Q1 2022. Facebook had 1.96 billion daily users in Q1 2022, a return to growth after its first-ever decline in Q4 2021, Meta reported on Wednesday. Meta's shares climbed as high as $210.14/share following the report.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase under probe in US: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's initial 9% Twitter stake purchase in early April is being probed by the US FTC, The Information reported. The FTC is probing if Musk complied with an antitrust reporting requirement when he bought the stake. It's focussing on whether Musk bought the stake to influence Twitter's management or if he looked to be a passive shareholder.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tata aims to build 80,000 EVs this financial year: Reuters
text: Tata Motors plans to ramp up its EV production and produce nearly 80,000 EVs in the current financial year, Reuters reported. The firm built and sold 19,000 EVs in the last financial year. At present, Tata Motors reportedly accounts for 90% of EV sales in India. The firm announced plans last year to launch 10 EV models by March 2026.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Future Retail directed to file reply on insolvency plea by May 12
text: National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has given Future Retail time till May 12 to file its reply to the insolvency plea filed by Bank of India. Future has defaulted on payment of ₹5,322.32 crore to a Bank of India-led consortium of lenders. This comes after Reliance called off its ₹24,713-crore deal with Future on Saturday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt asks state-run firms to consider buying Russian oil assets: Report
text: The Oil Ministry has reportedly asked state-run energy firms, including ONGC Videsh Ltd (OVL) and Indian Oil Corporation, to consider buying BP's stake in sanction-hit Russia's petroleum firm Rosneft. It comes after BP announced it's exiting its 19.75% stake in Rosneft. India hopes to get stakes in Russian assets at discounted rates given the risk involved, a source told Reuters.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: US GDP falls 1.4% in Q1, 1st time since pandemic recession began
text: US GDP contracted 1.4% in the January-March 2022 quarter, the Department of Commerce said on Thursday. This was the first time that the US economy has contracted since the pandemic recession began two years ago. Department of Commerce's data showed personal consumption, the biggest part of the economy, rose 2.7% in Q1 2022 compared with 2.5% in Q4 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 8 months' GST compensation sent to states, ₹78,704 cr pending: Govt
text: Finance Ministry on Wednesday said the Centre has released eight months of GST compensation for FY22 to states and compensation worth ₹78,704 crore is pending due to inadequate balance in the cess fund. During GST's implementation in 2017, Centre had agreed to compensate states till June 2022. It added that ₹7.35 lakh crore has been released to compensate revenue loss.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol will be cheaper if states cut taxes on fuel instead of liquor: Petroleum Minister
text: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday tweeted, "Petrol will be cheaper if opposition ruled states cut taxes on fuel instead of imported liquor!" He added, "Maharashtra govt imposes ₹32.15/ltr on petrol & Congress ruled Rajasthan ₹29.10. But BJP ruled Uttarakhand levies only ₹14.51 & Uttar Pradesh ₹16.50." He further wrote, "Protests cannot challenge facts!"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Twitter-Musk deal includes $1 billion termination fee for both the parties
text: Elon Musk will have to pay Twitter a fee of $1 billion if he terminates his $44 billion cash deal for the social media company, according to a regulatory filing. Twitter will have to pay the same fee under specified circumstances if it terminates the deal. The deal could be terminated if not closed by October 24, the filing added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: MP Mahua criticises Decathlon, says 'store insists I give my number to buy pants for dad'
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra complained about Decathlon store in Delhi and tweeted, "Want to buy my dad trousers for ₹1499 in CASH at Decathlon India...& manager insists I need to put in my mobile number & email ID to purchase." Stating that Decathlon is violating privacy and consumer laws, Moitra tweeted, "The sweet manager finally put in his number."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Govt asks electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches due to fire incidents: Reports
text: The government has asked electric two-wheeler manufacturers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated, reports said. The government has also cautioned manufacturers who did not have incidents to take corrective measures, reports added. The makers have also been asked to recall EVs from the particular batch of vehicles that the fires were reported on recently, reports stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What are the highlights of LIC's IPO announcement?
text: Shares in LIC IPO will be sold for ₹902-949 with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees, from May 4-9. LIC's IPO will be India's largest, with the government diluting its 3.5% stake for ₹20,557 crore. 10% of offer size is reserved for policyholders and 0.7% for employees. Anchor quota opens on May 2.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 7 IndiGo pilots found abusing over low salary on emergency frequency: Report
text: At least seven IndiGo pilots were allegedly found using offensive language on a frequency used for emergency communications, PTI reported. On April 9, these pilots were allegedly found using abusive language over low salaries on 121.5 MHz frequency, which is used for emergency communications only for the aircraft in distress. The DGCA has reportedly launched a probe in the matter.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
text: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
text: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Political neutrality is easy: Cuban after Musk says Twitter must be neutral
text: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban in response to Elon Musk's comment on making Twitter "politically neutral" said, "It's easy to be politically neutral. It's hard to be neutral about health and safety issues." Earlier, Musk said that to "deserve" the public's trust, Twitter "must be politically neutral". He added that it "effectively means upsetting the far-right and...far-left equally".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Apple opens Self Service Repair to iPhone users in US
text: Apple on Wednesday announced the launch of Self Service Repair in the US. As part of the facility, owners of iPhone 12, 13 and third-generation SE can go through repair manuals, and then buy the parts required to fix common issues with the handsets online. The service will be expanded to additional countries, starting with Europe, later this year.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
text: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Russia says it will wait & see how Musk's ownership affects Twitter
text: Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that Russia will wait and see how billionaire Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter will affect the platform. He also said that he doubted Western social media's capability to reflect different points of view. The statement comes as a Russian court reportedly fined Twitter $41,000 for not removing banned content from its site.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India's alternative fuels sector to create 50-60 lakh jobs: Gadkari
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said the alternative fuels sector will create 50-60 lakh jobs in India. He added that green hydrogen is the way forward and in the future, India will lead the world in this space. "My request to all manufacturers is that we need green hydrogen, because the government has a commitment for the environment," he stated.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Reduce central excise first: Cong on PM's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on petrol and diesel, Congress said that he should first reduce central excise. "(Centre) earned ₹26 lakh crore out of central excise...(and) didn't give the GST share to the states on time," Congress' Pawan Khera said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
text: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Paying for Russian gas in roubles breaches sanctions: EU chief
text: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said paying for Russian gas in roubles would breach sanctions imposed on Russia. "We have about 97% of all contracts that explicitly stipulate payments in euros or dollars," she said. Unless a supply contract was denominated in roubles, European firms should not accede to Russia's demands, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Australian inflation hits 20-yr high, petrol prices rise 35%
text: Australia's annual inflation rate hit 5.1% in Q1 2022, from 3.5% the previous quarter and the highest rate since 2001. While petrol prices gained 35%, cost of new dwellings climbed a record 13.7% and food prices also picked up. This could make the Reserve Bank of Australia raise interest rates from record lows ahead of the federal election, Reuters reported.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO size for policyholders
text: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) on Wednesday announced that it will be reserving 10% of its IPO size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders. Additionally, policyholders will be offered a discount of ₹60/share while employees and retail investors will be offered a discount of ₹45/share. The maximum bid amount under the Policyholder Reservation Portion must not exceed ₹2 lakh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
text: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED attaches ₹6.17 cr of fintech firms linked to Chinese nationals
text: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached ₹6.17 crore lying in bank and payment gateway accounts linked to fintech firms and individuals, including Chinese nationals, accused of lending money at usurious rates during the pandemic. According to ED, the accused issued loans and raised investments through mobile apps. The firms were registered on Chinese nationals' instructions.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Labour Ministry calls Infosys for discussion on non-compete clause
text: The Labour Ministry issued a notice to Infosys to hold a joint discussion on April 28 regarding the enforcement of the non-compete agreement. The agreement bans ex-employees from working for same customers in rival firms for six months. This comes after Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), an IT union, filed a complaint with the Ministry seeking the clause's removal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Indonesia export ban traps 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil for India: Report
text: Indonesia's palm oil export ban has trapped at least 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil shipments headed to India, Reuters reported citing industry officials. The widening of Indonesia's export ban and the consequent shipment disruptions will create vegetable oil shortage in India, the officials added. This comes shortly after India faced sunflower oil import shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hindustan Unilever's profit rises 8.6% YoY to ₹2,327 crore in Q4
text: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Wednesday reported an 8.6% rise in its profit after tax from ₹2,143 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹2,327 crore in Q4 FY22. Its profit in FY22 rose 10.9% YoY to ₹8,818 crore. The company said its revenue from sale of products  in Q4 FY22 came in at ₹13,190 crore, up 10.40% YoY from ₹11,947 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
text: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Air India's four Boeing 747 jets used for VIP travel deregistered
text: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has deregistered four Boeing 747 jumbo jets of Tata-owned Air India. DGCA said if Air India wants to use these aircrafts again for commercial flights, they'll have to undergo a return-to-service programme for re-registration. Till about two years ago, these 30-year-old jets were being used by the President, Vice President and Prime Minister.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Climate change risking 10-18% of South Asia's GDP: Study
text: Climate change could see 10-18% of GDP of South Asian countries like India, Bangladesh and Pakistan lost by 2050, a study by ratings firm S&P Global revealed. This is 10 times the risk to Europe and three times the risk to North America. Overall, climate change could put 4% of global GDP at risk by 2050, the report stated.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's largest IPO of LIC to open on May 4, price band ₹902-949 per share
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO will open on May 4 and close on May 9, the company confirmed on Wednesday. The price band will be ₹902-949, with a ₹60 discount for policyholders and ₹45 discount for retail investors and employees. The IPO, through which the government is selling its 3.5% LIC stake to raise ₹20,557 crore, will be India's largest.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla loses $126 billion in value amid Musk Twitter deal funding concerns
text: Tesla lost $126 billion in value amid investor concerns that CEO Elon Musk may have to sell shares to fund his $21 billion equity contribution to his $44 billion buyout of Twitter. Tesla isn't involved in Twitter deal, however its shares have been targeted by speculators after Musk declined to disclose where his cash for the acquisition is coming from.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Tesla welcome to India, but it must not import cars from China: Gadkari
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said that electric carmaker Tesla is welcome to set up shop in India, make cars for sale and export them, but the company must not import cars from China. "Making in China and selling here is not a good proposition," Gadkari said. Tesla has been working for a year to get tax breaks from India.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LIC IPO price band likely fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share: Reports
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) IPO price band has likely been fixed at ₹902-₹949 per share, reports said on Tuesday. There will be a ₹60 discount for policyholders, the reports added. Previous reports said the LIC IPO will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, with the government looking to raise ₹21,000 crore by diluting a 3.5% stake.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Reliance Industries becomes 1st Indian company to hit ₹19 lakh crore m-cap
text: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL) on Wednesday became the first Indian company to cross ₹19 lakh crore in market capitalisation. The company's stock jumped to a record high of ₹2,827.10 during intra-day trade on Wednesday. However, the ₹19 lakh crore market capitalisation milestone was briefly held by the company as the shares slid and were last trading at ₹2,781.65.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Air India proposes to acquire AirAsia India
text: Tata-owned Air India has proposed to acquire AirAsia India and has sought the deal's approval from the Competition Commission of India. AirAsia India is majority-owned by Tata Sons with a shareholding of 83.67% and the remaining stake is with AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India and Air India Express were acquired by Tata last year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World faces largest commodity shock since 1970s: World Bank amid Ukraine war
text: The World Bank amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war said, "The surging trade restrictions on food, fuel, and fertilisers are aggravating the largest commodity shock we've experienced since the 1970s." The "Major shock" at commodity markets "will keep prices at historically high levels through the end of 2024," said Indermit Gill, VP of Equitable Growth, Finance & Institutions at World Bank.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: List of IPL's most valuable teams released by Forbes, MI on top
text: Forbes has released the list of IPL's most valuable teams, with five-time champions MI ranked first with a value of $1.3 billion. CSK ($1.15 billion) are second on the list, followed by KKR ($1.1 billion) and debutants LSG ($1.075 billion). DC complete the top five with $1.035-billion value. GT, who are playing their first season, are last with $850 million.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk barred from disparaging Twitter when tweeting on $44-bn deal
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has been barred from disparaging Twitter or its representatives while tweeting about his $44-billion deal to buy the platform, a new securities filing showed. The filing has details of the transaction, including a section on "public announcements". Musk is still allowed to discuss the deal on Twitter if he follows the condition on his tweets.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: If Musk can afford Twitter, he can pay his taxes: US Congresswoman
text: US Congresswoman Marie Newman reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal, saying, "If he can afford Twitter, he can damn well afford to pay his fair share in taxes." She highlighted that Musk had paid $0 in federal taxes in 2018. "We need a Billionaire Tax NOW," she added. US Senator Elizabeth Warren has called the deal "dangerous" for democracy.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey eligible for $978 mn cash payout after Musk's deal: Reports
text: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey, who owns a 2.4% stake in the company, is eligible for a $978 million cash payout after Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion, according to reports. According to Musk's deal, he would be buying about 18,042,428 shares of Twitter that are owned by Dorsey for $54.20 each, the reports added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk's old Twitter chat on 'buying Twitter' goes viral
text: After Twitter accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company, an old Twitter chat between Musk and a Business Insider host has gone viral. In 2017, Musk tweeted, "I love Twitter," to which the host replied, "You should buy it then." Responding to the host, Musk had tweeted, "How much is it?"
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Don't know which direction Twitter will go: CEO Parag to employees over Musk takeover
text: On being asked about Elon Musk's plans for Twitter following a $44-billion takeover, CEO Parag Agrawal told his employees, "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go." "When we've an opportunity to speak with Elon...it's a question we should address with him," he added on being asked whether ex-US President Donald Trump would be allowed to return.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 'Forever 21 lost out on $150 mn in online sales,' says parent firm; sues Bolt
text: Forever 21's parent company Authentic Brands Group (ABG) has sued American payments startup Bolt, alleging that the startup failed to deliver promised technology. ABG also said that during Bolt's integration with Forever 21, the clothing retailer lost out on over $150 million in online sales. Bolt called ABG's claims "a transparent attempt" to renegotiate the terms of the companies' agreements.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Passenger shares pic of broken armrest on Air India plane; DGCA asks airline to repair it
text: DGCA has asked Tata Group-owned Air India to repair its aircraft after a passenger shared pictures of the plane's dirty panel and broken armrest on social media. DGCA asked the airline to rectify the problem as soon as possible. The plane will be in Kolkata on Monday night and the repair works will be done during that time, officials said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Reliance Industries, UAE-based TA'ZIZ sign $2 billion JV for chemical project
text:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries on Tuesday signed a formal shareholder agreement with Abu Dhabi Chemical Derivatives Company RSC Ltd (TA'ZIZ) for Ruwais Chemicals Project. The shareholder agreement for the over $2 billion TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC joint venture was signed. TA'ZIZ EDC & PVC will produce Chlor-Alkali, Ethylene Dichloride and Polyvinyl Chloride for
the first time in the UAE.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: FILA Philippines' 52-yr-old CEO found dead in Singapore, probe launched
text: Cris Albert, the 52-year-old CEO and owner of Philippines distributor for South Korean sportswear firm FILA Holdings, was found dead in Singapore on April 23. FILA Philippines confirmed her death in a Facebook post on Monday. Albert was found dead at Singapore's Fullerton Bay Hotel, and her death is being investigated by police as an unnatural one, as per reports.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I once rejected Dhirubhai's tender & he had asked, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai?': Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari during a News24 event said that he rejected Dhirubhai Ambani's tender for Mumbai-Pune highway while serving as a minister in Mumbai in 1995. Gadkari revealed, "Dhirubhai angrily asked me, 'Sarkar ki kya aukat hai? Aap kya road banaoge'." Gadkari added, "When Dhirubhai later saw the road's work...he was so nice...he told me, 'I lost, you won'."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani in advanced talks to buy Holcim's majority stake in Ambuja: Report
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group is in advanced talks to acquire Holcim Ltd's businesses in India, Bloomberg reported. Adani could sign a deal to buy a controlling stake in Ambuja Cements from Holcim in the coming days, Bloomberg added. Holcim, the world's largest cement maker, currently owns 63.1% stake in Ambuja, which has a market value of about $10 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ED raids ABG Shipyard premises in India's biggest bank fraud case: Reports
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly carried out raids at 26 premises linked to Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard on Tuesday. The company is accused of defrauding 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore in India's biggest bank fraud case ever. The raids were conducted at multiple premises of ABG Shipyard, its sister companies, as well as executives, in Mumbai, Pune and Surat, reports said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk hasn't backed projects that aren't game-changers: Ukraine Vice PM
text: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal saying, "Over the past decades, Elon Musk has not invested in projects that are not the game-changers of the industry." He added that he is sure an "unexpected turn in the development of social media" is on its way.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: France's Atos moves services delivered from Russia to India, Turkey
text: French IT consulting group Atos is moving its services currently delivered from Russia to other countries, including India and Turkey, amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war. Atos said the feasibility of the move has required significant planning in terms of implications for business operations and employees based in Russia. Atos stock lost half of its market value last year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Saudi PIF head committed to take Tesla private with me: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a news channel discussing texts between Saudi PIF and him, saying, "The head of Saudi PIF committed unequivocally to take Tesla private with me, as witnessed by...Tesla CFO and several others." The channel said the texts "confirm they were serious about taking Tesla private". "That is why I said funding was secured," Musk added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: B'luru airport registers record growth in cargo volumes in FY 2022
text: The Kempegowda International airport has recorded its highest-ever cargo tonnage in fiscal year (FY) 2022, the Bengaluru International Airport Limited said. The airport processed 4,11,513 metric tonnes (MT) of cargo in FY 2022, recording a growth of 26% as against 3,26,643 MT in FY 2021. International cargo saw a growth of 31% and domestic cargo grew at 17%, it added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: SEBI issues ₹2.05-cr recovery notice to ex-NSE official Subramanian
text: SEBI on Tuesday sent a notice to NSE's ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian, asking him to pay ₹2.05 crore in a case pertaining to governance lapses at NSE. This comes after Subramanian had earlier failed to pay a ₹2-crore fine to SEBI. In the event of non-payment of the latest fine, SEBI may recover the amount by selling Subramanian's assets.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI attaches Greentouch Projects' assets in illegal fundraising case
text: Market regulator SEBI has attached 14 properties related to Greentouch Projects and its four directors in an illegal fundraising case to recover ₹56 crore of investors' money. The attached properties include land parcels, plots, office spaces and a flat located in West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. The company claims to have already repaid over ₹12.24 crore to its investors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bajaj Finance reports highest-ever net profit of ₹2,420 cr in Q4
text: Bajaj Finance reported its highest-ever consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹2,419.51 crore in the January-March 2022 quarter, up 79.67% YoY from ₹1,346.64 crore. The company's net interest income for the quarter rose 30% YoY to ₹6,068 crore against ₹4,659 crore. Its assets under management grew 29% YoY to ₹1.97 lakh crore while new loans grew 15% to 6.28 million.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Elon Musk to buy Twitter for $44 billion
text: Twitter has accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company. It entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by an entity wholly owned by Musk, for $54.20 per share in cash in a transaction valued at approximately $44 billion. Upon completion of the transaction, Twitter will become a privately held company.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter CEO Parag set to receive $42 mn if terminated after Musk's takeover: Reports
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal would get an estimated $42 million if he is terminated within 12 months of a change in control at the social media company, according to reports quoting research firm Equilar. Musk in a securities filing had said he did not have confidence in Twitter's management. Musk has struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Twitter in final stages of negotiation for its sale to Elon Musk: Report
text: Twitter is in the final stretch of negotiations with the world's richest person, Elon Musk, about a potential sale of the microblogging site, Bloomberg reported on Monday. "Twitter could reach an agreement as soon as Monday," Bloomberg added, without specifying the date. A few days ago, Musk had said that he had secured $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer: Report
text: Twitter is set to agree on its sale to the world's richest man, Elon Musk, for around $43 billion in cash, Reuters reported on Monday. It is the price that Musk had called his "best and final" offer for the social media company. Twitter may announce the $54.20-per-share deal later on Monday, Reuters added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LIC IPO to open on May 4 and close on May 9: Reports
text: The initial public offering (IPO) of Life Insurance Corporation of India will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, reports said on Monday. The IPO, through which the government will sell a 3.5% stake in the state-owned firm, is expected to fetch ₹21,000 crore to the exchequer. The IPO size was scaled down from 5% earlier.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Veranda Learning to buy 30-yr-old test prep firm T.I.M.E. for ₹287 crore
text: Edtech company Veranda Learning on Monday said it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire T.I.M.E. (Advanced Educational Activities Pvt Ltd) for ₹287 crore. The acquisition will be conducted in two phases, 80% in the first phase, and the remaining 20% at the end of two years. Established in 1992, T.I.M.E. is a leading test-prep chain with a pan-India presence.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Twitter impacts the entire world: CEO Parag as Musk bags deal to buy Twitter
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal took to Twitter after the world's richest man Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter was accepted by the social media company's board. "Twitter has a purpose and relevance that impacts the entire world," tweeted Agrawal. He added, "Deeply proud of our teams and inspired by the work that has never been more important."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Banks ask NPCI to clarify stance on UPI for crypto trading: Report
text: Several banks have asked the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to issue a formal directive over restrictions regarding the use of United Payments Interface (UPI) to purchase and sell virtual digital assets, the Economic Times reported. Some banks have blocked UPI for crypto trading following "verbal instructions" from NPCI, the report said, adding a circular from NPCI is unlikely.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Free speech bedrock of functioning democracy: Musk as Twitter accepts buyout offer
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk said, "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy," after Twitter accepted his offer to take the social media company private for approximately $44 billion. He added, "Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated." Musk will buy each Twitter share for $54.20 in cash.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon is the singular solution I trust: Jack Dorsey on Musk's $44-bn Twitter takeover
text: After Elon Musk struck a $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter, the micro-blogging platform's billionaire  Co-founder Jack Dorsey tweeted, "In principle...I don’t believe anyone should own or run Twitter." He added, "It wants to be a public good at a protocol level, not a company. Solving for the problem of it being a company however...Elon is the singular solution I trust."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Twitter executives met Musk to discuss $43 bn takeover bid: Reports
text: Twitter executives met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday to discuss his $43 billion takeover offer, reports said. The development comes after Musk revealed that he has secured $46.5 billion in funding to take the social media company private. Musk has been meeting with Twitter shareholders recently to seek support for his bid, Reuters reported.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: More than half of India’s 900 million workforce stop looking for jobs: Report
text: More than half of the 900 million Indians of legal working age aren't looking for jobs, data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) has indicated. In March 2022, the labour force shrunk by 3.8 million to 428 million, marking its lowest since July 2021, data showed. The overall labour participation rate dropped from 46% to 40% during 2017-2022.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: World's 6th richest man Buffett to auction one last private lunch for charity
text: Warren Buffett, the 91-year-old Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth richest person, will auction off a private lunch for one last time to raise money for charity. Buffett has held the lunch auction since 2000 and raised nearly $34.5 million for charity over the years. In 2019, cryptocurrency pioneer Justin Sun paid record $4,567,888 to dine with Buffett.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Twitter user calls Musk's deal 'shameful', Dogecoin Co-creator reacts
text: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus liked a post on Twitter that called Elon Musk's Twitter deal "shameful" and said he could have given $1 million to every person in the world instead. "I know! Why didn't he fix all my specific problems exclusively instead of doing what he wanted with his own money," Markus said jokingly.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Morgan Stanley acting as Musk's lead adviser in $44 bn Twitter deal
text: Morgan Stanley is acting as Elon Musk's lead adviser in his $44 billion Twitter deal. Bank of America and Barclays have also advised him. At least nine other banks are reportedly helping Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Barclays provide $25.5 billion in debt for the deal. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, and boutique investment bank Allen advised Twitter.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: RBI imposes ₹1.12 crore penalty on Bank of Maharashtra
text: The Reserve Bank of India said it has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.12 crore on Bank of Maharashtra for non-compliance. As per RBI, the non-compliance is related to certain directions under KYC. The state-run bank failed to allot Unique Customer Identification Codes to its individual customers and to review the outsourcing arrangement for an outsourced financial service, RBI added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI moving towards managing inflation won't hurt growth: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the RBI's plan to begin moving towards management of inflation wouldn't hurt India's economic growth. "The growth is not getting compromised, because [government] policies...have also been in such a way that supply-side supports have continued including infrastructure investments," she stated. She also defended RBI's timing to pivot toward inflation.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Eveready Industries reports ₹38.41 crore loss in Q4 FY22
text: Eveready Industries on Monday reported consolidated net loss of ₹38.41 crore in the January-March quarter. The company had posted net loss of ₹442.53 crore in Q4 FY21, it said in a regulatory filing. Its revenue from operations in Q4 FY22 rose 17.82% YoY from ₹249.81 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹294.33 crore while its total expenses stood at ₹241.23 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India buys twice as much Russian oil in 2 months than in 2021: Report
text: India has bought over twice the amount of crude oil from Russia in the last two months than it did in entire 2021, Reuters reported. As per the report, Indian refiners have placed orders for at least 40 million barrels of Russian oil since Ukraine's invasion on February 24. Russia is selling oil at steep discounts amid Western sanctions.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's GDP expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23: CII President
text: Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President TV Narendran said India's GDP is expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23, with exports playing a key role. Referring to the Russia-Ukraine war, Narendran said no country can remain unaffected from events taking place outside its borders. "Even though India's...economic engagement with Russia or Ukraine is low, this does not shield us," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India, Russia in talks to restart coking coal supplies: Report
text: Indian and Russian officials held talks in New Delhi last week where Russia urged India to move forward with their last year's deal on coking coal imports, Reuters reported. Since March, Russian coal supply to India has stopped amid Western sanctions. Meanwhile, India's top coking coal supplier Australia has raised its prices from $200 to $700 per tonne.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Housing prices may sustainably rise 8% this fiscal: India Ratings
text: India Ratings and Research on Monday said housing prices are expected to rise by 8% this fiscal mainly due to a rise in demand. "The price hike will be sustainable and is likely to be incremental. Prices were up 6% pan-India in FY22," the agency said. It expects the affordable housing segment to continue claiming around 50% of total sales.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rise in policy rates not anti-national activity: Raghuram Rajan
text: Politicians and bureaucrats need to understand that rise in policy rates isn't some anti-national activity benefiting foreign investors, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan wrote on LinkedIn. He added, "Inflation's up in India...At some point, the RBI will have to raise rates, like the rest of the world." His remarks came as India's retail inflation reached a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Future Group shares fall up to 20% after Reliance cancels deal
text: Shares of Future Group companies plummeted on Monday, with Future Lifestyle Fashions and Future Supply Chain Solutions each trading 20% lower. Meanwhile, Future Retail stock dropped 5% to ₹27.80 per share.This comes after Reliance Industries called off its ₹24,713-crore deal to acquire Future Group's assets after secured creditors of the latter voted against the proposal.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Air India loses preferential access to int'l traffic rights
text: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) dropped a clause that gave the former national carrier, Air India, preferential access to international traffic rights over private airlines. As per the revised circular, the government may now grant or deny allocation of traffic rights to any airline based on its "preparedness" and "viability" of operations on a route, among other factors.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Yes Bank files insolvency plea against Zee over ₹468 cr default
text: Yes Bank has moved the National Company Law Tribunal seeking to initiate corporate insolvency proceedings against Zee Learn, claiming a default of ₹468 crore. As per Zee Learn, it received a notice from the Mumbai bench of the NCLT over Yes Bank's petition on Monday. It is in the process of compiling information to verify the facts, the company added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Indonesia's palm oil export ban will exclude crude palm oil: Reports
text: Palm oil companies were told by Indonesian government officials on Monday that the export ban on palm oil wouldn't cover export of crude palm oil, Reuters reported citing sources. President Joko Widodo had announced on Friday that palm oil exports would be banned in Indonesia from April 28. He said the export ban aims to ensure domestic food product availability.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India a technological powerhouse: EU chief on launching trade, tech body with India
text: India and the European Union (EU) have decided to launch a Trade and Technology Council to tackle challenges in trade, trusted technology and security. "We have India as a technological powerhouse," said EU chief Ursula von der Leyen while holding talks with PM Narendra Modi in Delhi. Till now, EU only had one such council in place with the US.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: UPI server faces outage, users from across India complain of failed payments
text: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) server appeared to be down for more than an hour on Sunday evening, causing disruptions in payments across India. Several users took to Twitter to complain about failed payments on major UPI apps, including PhonePe, Google Pay and Paytm. The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is yet to issue a statement on the outage.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani overtakes Buffett to become world's 5th richest person: Forbes
text: Adani Group's 59-year-old Chairman Gautam Adani has overtaken Berkshire Hathaway's 91-year-old CEO Warren Buffett to become the world's fifth-richest person with a net worth of over $123.7 billion as of Friday's close, Forbes said. Adani's net worth stood at $8.9 billion just two years ago, Forbes added. Shares of Adani's businesses are up by between 19% to 195% this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 5th richest?
text: Gautam Adani overtook Berkshire Hathaway's Warren Buffett to become the world's 5th-richest person with $123.7 billion wealth, Forbes said. Elon Musk is the richest worldwide with $269.7 billion in wealth, followed by Jeff Bezos, LVMH's Bernard Arnault & family and Bill Gates. Buffett is 6th-richest, followed by Larry Ellison, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Mukesh Ambani and Google's Sergey Brin.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Billionaire Jack Dorsey drops his CEO title at Block, calls himself 'Block Head'
text: Twitter's billionaire Co-founder Jack Dorsey, who Co-founded fintech startup Block (previously Square), has changed his title of CEO at Block to 'Block Head and Chairperson'. "There will be no changes in Dorsey's roles and responsibilities," Block said in a regulatory filing. World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to Dorsey, "Your new title at Block is...," followed by two fire emojis.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: TCS could become the world's largest IT company: CEO
text: Tata Consultancy Services' (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said, "Absolutely. In many ways, we already are," when he was asked if the Indian IT services major could become the world's largest IT company. Gopinathan also said, "Today we are $25 billion in size...There is no reason we shouldn't aspire to be double, triple, quadruple of the size we are today."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: PM urges people to try 'Cashless Day Out' using only digital mode for payments
text: PM Narendra Modi has urged people to try a 'Cashless Day Out' by using only digital mode for payments. He gave an example of two girls from Delhi who spent an entire day roaming the city without doing any money transactions in cash. He said that people in small towns and in most villages are also transacting through UPI itself.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Moving on from making fun of Bill Gates for shorting Tesla: Musk
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Moving on..." After several Twitter users began guessing that Musk is moving on from his desire to buy Twitter, Musk tweeted, "(from making fun of Gates for shorting Tesla while claiming to support climate change action)". Earlier, Musk admitted to confronting Bill Gates on shorting Tesla stock.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter begins deal talks with Elon Musk: Report
text: Twitter on Sunday began deal negotiations after Tesla CEO Elon Musk pursued many of the social media company's shareholders with financing details on his $43 billion acquisition offer, according to a Reuters report. Musk has said Twitter needs to be taken private to grow and become a genuine platform for free speech.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Forced to buy ₹2-cr painting from Priyanka, money used for Sonia's treatment: Rana Kapoor
text: Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor has told Enforcement Directorate he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi for ₹2 crore. He added that the sale proceeds were utilised by Gandhi family for the medical treatment of Congress President Sonia Gandhi in New York. It was revealed in the chargesheet filed by ED in a special court.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: At least spare the dead: Cong to Rana Kapoor for allegations on Patel, Deora
text: Congress termed Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor's allegations against late leaders Murli Deora and Ahmed Patel, and party leader, Priyanka Gandhi, "political vendetta". "At least spare the dead," Congress said. Kapoor alleged he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka for ₹2 crore for funding Sonia's treatment and Patel told him, "You're (Kapoor) doing a good deed".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: People sold properties, ended up losing everything: Officer who probed Amway fraud
text: Telangana IPS officer VC Sajjanar who has been looking into Multi-Level Marketing (MLM) frauds by companies like Amway, has said that people who invested in such companies "sold or mortgaged properties". "[They] ended up losing everything," said Sajjanar. Talking about the 'MLM-craze', he said, "Families were being torn apart and the social fabric was breaking."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BNP Paribas trader fired for 'emotional terrorism' against staff sues for $4mn in France
text: Omar Alami, who was fired from his position as the head of BNP Paribas's equity derivatives sales for Switzerland, Belgium and Luxembourg in 2019, is suing the French bank for $4 million for unfairly dismissing him. The bank's lawyer has said that employees accused Alami of "emotional terrorism" and behaviour that left them with "a feeling of waterboarding".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Cyient to buy Finland's Citec for €94 mn in its largest-ever acquisition
text: Hyderabad-based engineering and technology solutions provider Cyient announced on Monday it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Finland-based Citec, in its largest acquisition to date. Cyient will acquire the plant and product engineering services company for €94 million in an all-cash deal. It will be the largest outbound acquisition by an Indian engineering services company, Cyient said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Aditya Birla Capital appoints Vishakha Mulye as new CEO
text: Aditya Birla Capital on Saturday said that it has appointed Vishakha Mulye as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). The company's present CEO Ajay Srinivasan plans to move out of his current role and take up another role within Aditya Birla Group. Mulye is a chartered accountant by qualification and currently an Executive Director of ICICI Bank, the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mahindra tags Elon Musk in tweet calling Indian bullock cart 'original Tesla'
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted a message on the Indian bullock cart, which called the latter the "original Tesla vehicle". "No Google Map required, no fuel to buy, no pollution, fully self-driven...relax, take a nap, reach your destination," said the message. "Back to the future," said Mahindra, while tagging Tesla CEO Elon Musk in the tweet.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bitcoin falls to six-week low, Ether declines nearly 5%
text: Bitcoin fell as much as 3.2% to $38,236 on Monday, marking the crypto's lowest level since March 15. The world's largest cryptocurrency extended this month's losses as investors shied away from risk assets amid a more hawkish outlook for US Federal Reserve policy tightening. Ether, the second-biggest crypto, also slumped 4.8% to $2,799, a level not seen since March 18.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's oil imports nearly double to $119.2 billion in FY22
text: India imported 212.2 million tonnes of crude oil, worth $119.2 billion, in the fiscal year that ended on March 31, Petroleum Ministry's data showed. This is nearly double the $62.2 billion that India spent on 196.5 million tonnes of oil in the previous fiscal. India bought $13.7 billion-oil in March alone, when oil prices surged to 14-year high.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SII urges Centre to use 10 crore Covishield vaccines given by GAVI
text: The Serum Institute of India (SII) urged the Centre to immediately use the 10 crore Covishield doses provided free of cost by vaccine alliance GAVI amid rising coronavirus cases, PTI reported. SII said if the doses aren't taken by the government timely, it'll lead to wastage of the vaccines. India reported 2,593 new cases in 24 hours to Sunday morning.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: IMF assures support to Sri Lanka in overcoming economic crisis
text: International Monetary Fund (IMF) has assured its support to the Sri Lankan government in overcoming the country's ongoing economic crisis. It termed the meeting with Sri Lankan Finance Minister Ali Sabry and Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe as "fruitful". IMF said its team will work closely with authorities on their economic programme and engage with stakeholders to resolve the crisis.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs, net sellers since Oct, withdraw ₹12,286 cr between Apr 1-22
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹12,286 crore between April 1-22, data with depositories showed. FPIs had withdrawn ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022 and became net investors between April 1-8, for the first time in six months, by investing net ₹7,707 crore. They have been net sellers since then, withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 11-13.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US oil falls below $100 mark as China lockdowns stoke demand fears
text: Oil price fell below the $100 mark again on Monday as prolonged COVID-19 lockdowns in China stoked fears regarding waning demand for oil. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.11 to $97.96/barrel, Brent crude fell $4.63 to $102.02/barrel. Oil prices also likely weakened on the prospect of higher interest rates in the US, which is boosting the US dollar.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World's top palm oil producer Indonesia bans exports
text: Indonesia, which is the world's top palm oil producer, announced plans to ban palm oil exports from April 28 amid a record rise in global food inflation. President Joko Widodo said he wanted to ensure that the availability of cooking oil was "abundant" and "affordable" in Indonesia. As per Solvent Extractors' Association Of India (SEA), this will hurt Indian consumers.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Adani Power sixth Adani group firm to hit ₹1 lakh cr m-cap
text: Adani Power became the sixth Adani Group firm to cross ₹1 lakh-crore market valuation after its shares hit an all-time high of ₹272 apiece on Monday. The stock has risen over 100% in a month and about 290% since hitting a 52-week low of ₹69.95 in August 2021. Earlier, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, among others, hit this milestone.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Tata Motors also hikes vehicle prices after Maruti Suzuki
text: Tata Motors on Saturday said it has hiked the prices of its passenger vehicles by an average of 1.1% with immediate effect to partially offset the rise in input cost. This comes after Maruti Suzuki increased the prices of all its models by 1.3% on April 18. Last month, Tata Motors announced a 2-2.5% price hike on commercial vehicles.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Religare Enterprises resolves all legacy issues with SEBI
text: Religare Enterprises Limited (REL) on Sunday said it has resolved all legacy issues with market regulator SEBI. REL said the overlooked compliance requirements pointed out by SEBI took place when the firm's control and management rested with former promoters Malvinder and Shivinder Mohan Singh. "The erstwhile promoters have already been reclassified as public shareholders," REL added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FM Sitharaman urges Indian diaspora to become partners in growth
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday urged the Indian diaspora to become partners in India's growth in the next 25 years. Addressing the Indian community in Silicon Valley, San Francisco Bay Area, Sitharaman spoke about structural reforms undertaken by the Centre. She also highlighted the stellar contributions of Indian diaspora in US, especially their role in innovation and research.
author: Ashley Paul
